description:
PC Support / Network Support / Technology Help Desk - College Internship Opening (Paid)

Job Description:

We are currently seeking a local college intern that would like to join our company to perform a wide range of PC Support, Networking Support, and general Help Desk Support functions at our company headquarters in Hicksville, NY.

Our technology environment includes over 80 PC's, (5) Microsoft Servers, a local and wide area network, Microsoft SQL* Server, MS-Office 365, and cloud-based computing applications for system administration and accounting.

We are seeking a college intern to work between 15 - 25 hours a week during our normal business hours which are Monday - Friday, 8am - 6pm. This an on-going part-time position including summers.

The position pays $15 per hour.

Qualifications include:

  • Current local college students majoring in Information Technology, Computer Science, or Computer Engineering.
  • Candidates must be attending college on Long Island.
  • We are interviewing students currently in their Sophomore year
  • Current GPA of 3.0 or better
  • Current knowledge of computer hardware, Microsoft operating systems, and basic computer networking, and solid knowledge of Microsoft Office
  • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills

About Horizon Healthcare Staffing

Horizon Healthcare Staffing has been providing healthcare staffing services in the New York and New Jersey Metropolitan area since 1992. As a leading provider of rehabilitation, nursing, and allied health personnel in the region, we pride ourselves on our commitment to both the facilities and organizations we help staff as well as to the community of healthcare professionals we serve to help find employment. https://www.hhstaff.com

#HHS

Is this you?

If so, we have a great opportunity waiting: the Intern Software Developer will learn a multitude of software development languages and strategies. Prove yourself and you'll quickly convert to a full-time employee with competitive pay and benefits.

At Datix we:

Datix is a rapidly growing software consulting services company based in St. Louis, MO with clients throughout North America. NVIDIA is looking for a Software Engineering Intern to work in IPP (Infrastructure, Planning and Process).

IPP is a global organization within NVIDIA. This group works with various other groups within NVIDIA Software such as Graphics Processors, Mobile Processors, Deep Learning, Artificial Intelligence and Driveless Cars to cater to their infrastructure needs. These cloud services provide almost half a million automated jobs per day on thousands of servers helping with the efficiency of thousands of NVIDIA's software engineers worldwide.

The cloud hosts heterogeneous mix of machines and devices with various operating systems (Windows/Linux/Android), multitude of hardware platforms both NVIDIA GPUs and Tegra Processors. We’re looking for someone who can thrive in a fast moving environment and love being challenged to learn new things. You’ll come in with a basic understanding of engineering and operational principles and leave with a head filled to bursting with tools, processes, practices, and technology solutions.

What you'll be doing:

  • Developing and improving cloud automation, reporting, and monitoring

  • Proactively contribute to documentation, automation, and processes as they evolve

  • Learn about building and operating services at scale in a fast-iteration setup

  • Own small projects supporting internal process engineering efforts

  • Develop a working understanding of some of the common tools and practices used for microservice development and infrastructure

  • Work on fast paced DevOps engineering team

What we need to see:

  • Currently enrolled in a graduate program in Computer Science or related subject area. Completed undergraduate degree in Computer Science or Software Engineering is requirement

  • Strong object-oriented programming background, Java, Python preferred.

  • Familiarity with Container management solutions (Docker, Kubernetes)

  • Experience with CI/CD tools (Jenkins etc.) & practice , source code management systems ex: Git , GitLab etc.

  • Familiarity with Relational Databases such as MySQL, NoSQL DBs such as Elastic Search, MongoDB, HBase

  • Ability to turn design, compliance, and support references/content into documentation, presentations, and training

Ways to stand out from the crowd:

  • Familiarity with Windows, Linux operating systems as well as network technologies

  • Background with AWS or other cloud computing platforms

  • Ability to analyze situations and utilize troubleshooting skills, systems and tools, and problem solving abilities

NVIDIA is widely considered to be one of the technology world’s most desirable employers. We have some of the most forward-thinking and hardworking people in the world working for us. If you're creative and passionate about developing cloud services we want to hear from you!

NVIDIA is committed to fostering a diverse work environment and proud to be an equal opportunity employer. As we highly value diversity in our current and future employees, we do not discriminate (including in our hiring and promotion practices) on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, gender expression , sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, disability status or any other characteristic protected by law.

position: 2021 Intern, Software Engineering, Machine Learning, Research (Fall)
description:
Waymo is an autonomous driving technology company with a mission to make it safe and easy for people and things to get where they’re going. Since our start as the Google Self-Driving Car Project in 2009, Waymo has been focused on building the World’s Most Experienced Driver in hopes of improving the world's access to mobility while saving thousands of lives now lost to traffic crashes. Our Waymo Driver powers Waymo One, our fully autonomous ride-hailing service, as well as Waymo Via, our trucking and local delivery service. To date, Waymo has driven over 20 million miles autonomously on public roads across 25 U.S. cities and conducted over 20 billion miles of simulation testing.

Software Engineering builds the brains of Waymo's fully autonomous vehicles. Our software allows our vehicles to perceive the world around them, make the right decision for every situation, and deliver people safely to their destinations. We think deeply and solve complex technical challenges in areas like robotics, perception, decision-making and deep learning, while collaborating with hardware and systems engineers. If you’re a software engineer or researcher who’s curious and passionate about autonomous driving, we'd like to meet you.

The mission of the Waymo Research team is to develop machine learning solutions addressing open problems in autonomous driving, towards the goal of the safely operating Waymo vehicles in dozens of cities and under all driving conditions. As part of our work, we also initiate and foster collaborations with other research teams in Alphabet. Research areas that we are currently focusing on include perception, behavior prediction and reinforcement learning.

Waymo interns work alongside leaders in the industry on projects that deliver significant impact to the company. We believe learning is a two-way street: leveraging your knowledge while providing you with opportunities to expand your skill-set. Interns are an important part of our culture and our recruiting pipeline. Join us at Waymo for a fun and rewarding internship!

In this research internship, you'll:

  • Conduct cutting edge research to develop new algorithms to solve challenging real-world problems such as behavior prediction, imitation learning, planning and controls
  • Deploy your algorithms and models onto a fleet of self driving cars
  • Participate in publishing findings in academic conferences and journals

At a minimum we’d like you to have:

  • Enrolled in a PhD program in Computer Science, Robotics or similar technical field of study
  • Strong algorithmic background
  • Experience in at least one of: computer vision, machine learning, or robotics
  • Strong coding experience in C++ and Python

It’s preferred if you have:

  • Experience with Tensorflow or deep learning models
  • Large-scale data processing and analytical skills
  • Demonstrated interest in research and development through academic projects or Publications

General Perks

  • Help solve challenging problems with a direct impact on the company
  • Competitive compensation packages with a housing/relocation bonus (if applicable)
  • Medical, dental, and vision insurance
  • Fun intern events and networking opportunities

Onsite Perks (These perks will only be applicable if the internship is on site)

  • Free breakfast, lunch, dinner, and snacks
  • Free access to Google shuttles
  • Onsite gym

Note: This fall internship position is planned to be located in our Mountain View office. However, as the situation around COVID-19 remains unclear, this position may switch to fully virtual. Your recruiter will discuss the available options during the interview process. We will accept resumes on a rolling basis until the role is filled. To be in consideration for multiple roles, you will need to apply to each one individually - please apply to the top 3 roles you are interested in.

At Waymo, we don’t just accept differences - we celebrate it, we support it, and we thrive on it for the benefit of our employees, our products and our community. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know.

At Cirrus Logic, mixed-signal engineering drives our company. We develop high-performance, low-power signal processing solutions in audio, voice and haptics, delivering innovative end-user experiences and solving difficult challenges for new generations of mobile and consumer devices. While breaking the innovation barrier, we’ve also built an award-winning company culture, thanks to our extraordinary workforce and our ongoing efforts to champion and promote diversity, as well as our principles of equality and fairness in the workplace. Do you enjoy working alongside the industry's top engineers and solving sophisticated challenges for the world's top consumer brands? Join our team and help us continue to make this an exceptional place to work!

Cirrus Logic is looking for an Electrical Engineering/Computer Science graduate or undergraduate student to assist in the development of key components for one of our new desktop product-configuration and -tuning tools. You will be a contributor for doing real development work, delivering Java application components, as part of a small multi-function team consisting of software architects, developers, and systems engineers. You can expect to contribute to the full development process including design, implementation, and testing.

Responsibilities

  • Work within a multi-discipline software development team that develops advanced software tools for mixed-signal devices and signal processing algorithms
  • Contribute to the development of key components for a new desktop tool
  • Write clean, maintainable, and tested code
  • Collaborate with the team to clarify, breakdown, and estimate requirements
  • Work with stakeholders and teammates to create, review, and implement designs

Required Skills and Qualifications

  • Actively pursuing a BS or MS in Computer Science or Computer Engineering (or similar relevant area)
  • Understanding of at least one programming language (Java, C++, C#, etc.)
  • Experience with data structures and algorithms
  • Strong desire to learn both soft and technical skills

Preferred Skills and Qualifications

  • Development experience in Java
  • UI development experience (JavaFX , Swing, Qt)
  • Familiarity with IntelliJ, Eclipse, or other modern IDEs
  • Experience with Unit Testing and Test Driven Development (JUnit, NUnit, MSTest)
  • Understanding of version control (git, SVN)
  • Experience with build and test automation (Jenkins)
  • Agile Scrum software development experience

This position is located in Austin, TX

Cirrus Logic is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, national origin, pregnancy status, marital status, gender, age, religion, physical or mental disability, medical condition, veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information or any other characteristic protected by law.

About the role:

Carimus is looking for an innovative and ambitious college student to join our development team. We are looking for a Product Intern to work on our Product teams. This is an exciting opportunity to help the team work on internal products, including GoodBookey and JouleBug. The intern will use their programming and problem-solving skills to assist in the development of these apps. The ideal intern will be excited to work with a variety of technologies and is familiar with a variety of operating systems and platforms. If you are a talented engineering student looking for an opportunity to grow your coding experience this is the role for you.

We are looking for someone that has the capacity to work 20 hours per week.

Responsibilities:

  • Assist in the creation of scalable software platforms and applications that are unit tested, code reviewed and checked regularly for continuous integration

  • Gather user requirements, define system functionality and write code in various languages, like javascript, PHP and Sacal using libraries such as React.js, Laravel and Play

  • Give and receive feedback for assigned projects

  • Understand client requirements and how they translate into application features

  • Define Quarterly / Monthly Objectives with Direct Manager

Qualifications:

Required:

  • Currently enrolled in an undergraduate program in Computer Science, Engineering, or Information Technology

  • Experience with front end development in React and JavaScript

  • Interest in writing real code and seeing it in production

  • Interest in learning new technologies and developing new skills

  • Dedicated to customer service and making a difference for our customers

  • Excellent technical and communication abilities

  • Ability to be comfortable working in a fast-paced environment and enjoys working on multiple projects concurrently


Nice to have:

  • Knowledge or experience with Laravel or other similar MVC frameworks

  • Experience with OOP or functional programming

  • Experience with either Android or iOS native development

  • Knowledge or experience with Git

  • Knowledge or experience with relational databases such as MySQL or PostgreSQL and non-relational databases

Carimus provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws.

About us

MarkLogic is a fast-growth, pre-IPO company building products that impact millions of people every day. Our customers include Airbus, Johnson & Johnson, J.P. Morgan Chase, Sony, and the U.S. Department of Defense to name a few. Across the globe, our technology has been used to discover new medicines, run the world's financial systems, prevent terrorism, and much more. If that's something that interests you, we'd love to talk.

Data integration is a complex, $50B/year problem that every organization faces. Our mission is to fix it.

We developed a highly differentiated technology, the MarkLogic Data Hub Platform, which simplifies data integration and enables organizations to achieve a 360° view faster than ever. With one platform it enables organizations to integrate all of their data, power transactional and analytical applications, and curate data for machine learning and AI. MarkLogic became the world's best database for integrating data from silos - by thinking differently. We don't believe in marketing hype and do believe that telling our customers' stories of how they're solving complex data challenges is the best way to tell ours.

The Role

Our Database Engineering group is seeking inquisitive engineers/interns that are passionate in areas such as distributed software systems, database systems, SQL/SPARQL engine optimization, machine learning, search/query engines and security. As an intern at MarkLogic, you will design and develop key new features of the core database that have direct impact on our worldwide customers. You will be part of a very collaborative team that will provide you with the necessary tools, help and mentorship to make sure you will succeed with your project.

Our interns have an opportunity through their assigned projects to contribute directly to the development of the next generation MarkLogic Database.

Core Qualifications

Ability to solve problems

Advanced Java coding skills

Experience working on HTML, CSS, JavaScript & JQuery

Experience working on modern JavaScript frameworks like Angular, VueJS, React, etc. is preferred

Undergraduate/Graduate student studying Computer Science, Engineering or related discipline at a top leading institution

Advanced documentation and debugging skills

Excellent communication skills

School projects or intern experience with any of the following is a plus

Database technologies: Enterprise RDBMS technologies or NoSQL solutions

Query language implementation like XQuery, JavaScript

AWS and/or Azure

Search engine technologies

Document and data formats – JSON, XML, RDF and related technologies

In addition, we will provide reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities.

Job Description: Marketing / Communication Intern


Looking to make a difference in your community? Are you looking for a career with opportunities to advance, then ABI New England is the place for you!

Company summary

Our mission is to deliver compassionate, personalized, and precise ABA services across the lifespan. Our work is grounded in the science of Applied Behavior Analysis (ABA) because ABA is the #1 proven approach to make a difference. Every day we strive to apply our passion for science to change lives. We invite you to join us in making a commitment to be ‘Ready for Life’, personally, professionally, and in service to a brighter tomorrow.

Job summary

ABI is seeking a Marketing / Communication Intern with strong customer service, social media and internet base skills to join our team. The ideal candidate will be responsible to conduct and manage out/incoming marketing and referral calls as well coordinating social media and web-based updates/outreach. This is a part-time position.


Job responsibilities:

  • Outreach (calls/visits) to local referral sources.
  • Outreach / connectivity with local community members / leaders / resources.
  • Development and dissemination of marketing materials.
  • Manage Website updates.
  • Manage social media outreach / maintenance.
  • Referral contact database development / upkeep.
  • Support ABI administrative tasks / schedules.


Skills:

  • Microsoft office knowledge (word, excel, outlook)
  • Social media savvy
  • Excellent writing and communications skills
  • Courteous and professional
  • Team player
  • Computer knowledge
  • Customer service
  • Sense of urgency
  • Medium work-lifting 50 lbs. maximum with frequent lifting and or carrying of objects weighing up to 25 lbs.

About Us

VIGP provides customized and trusted counseling services that includes college preparedness counseling, school application, and ongoing mentoring, to international students and new immigrants in the US. Our goal is to help students succeed in higher education, life, and career; in turn, we can make a difference for good in their lives and their communities. We are located in Seattle, Washington. Our team members are young, passionate, and supportive to each other. We are looking forward to having you in our team to serve and help more students.

This position is for a web developer intern with a passion for helping international students and wanting to make a difference in their lives.

Job Description

We are looking for a web developer who will own the success of our website and our customer web portal. You will be involved in building, maintaining, and managing our Wordpress website and our React webapp for the customer portal. You should have a good understanding of web design and be able to turn mock ups, wireframes, conceptual drawings into functional web pages, and take ownership in implementing any changes to the website to make it successful, functional, and usable for our clients.

This is an unpaid internship that presents you with a great opportunity to add quality work experience to your resume, to learn more about working with international students from around the world, and to gain valuable experience in web development for a startup company.

Responsibilities

  • Build, maintain, and improve our WordPress website & React webapp with content, features, and functionality
  • Implement UI changes with responsive design and mobile-experience in mind
  • Collaborate with our team to implement design changes, new UI components, and new functionality as needed
  • Implement quality code independently with best practices
  • Test, debug, and troubleshoot any issues that may come up with our website/webapp
  • Basic management of page load speed, performance, and security
  • Basic monitoring of website traffic

Qualifications

  • College degree in related field
  • 1 year web development experience (previous internship/school projects can be considered)
  • Experience in HTML, CSS, Javascript
  • Understanding of how web applications work such as HTTP requests, web security, session management, and other technical aspects of web.
  • Willingness to explore, iterate, and collaborate on difficult problems
  • Able to present previous projects
  • Comfortable working both individually and in team settings
  • Strong communication skills (written and verbal)
  • Language Requirement: English and Mandarin

An exceptional candidate will also have:

  • Experience with WordPress

Job Type

  • Unpaid position
  • Remote
  • 20 hours per week, Monday-Friday
  • Minimum 6 months duration
  • OPT/CPT welcome

About the Company:

Founded in 1970, Kinetico pioneered the development of non-electric, fully automatic water treatment systems. In the years since, we have grown into a global company of independent Kinetico water experts and international distributors serving more than 100 countries. We offer complete water systems that deliver only the highest quality water for general use and drinking. We back every piece of our equipment with industry-leading warranties. Our approach reflects our deep commitment to preserving and conserving fresh water, one of our planet's most precious and endangered natural resources.


About the Position:

The Workflow Automation Intern will further leverage the Microsoft workflow automation tools and serve as a resource that can implement some proof of concept projects to better understand if these tools will work for Kinetico. Experience gained form this paid internship will be how to apply the use of a tool in a business and drive value from implementing workflow automation.

Option to work onsite in Newbury, OH, or anywhere in the US.


Key Areas of Responsibility:

  • Collect input from users on what they are wanting to automate
  • Use the MS Power Flow and Power Builder apps to develop and automate work flow tools
  • Test out the MS power flow tools to see what their capabilities are and how they can benefit Kinetico
  • Document any development work performed


Job Knowledge, Skills, and Experience:

  • Computer Science Major with emphasis on computer programming
  • Experienced with the Microsoft Power Automate and Power Apps
  • Experience with SQL Relational Data Base
  • Knowledge of how to map out a process flow using a flowcharting tool like Visio

Come work, learn and innovate for an amazing tech company located in NYC.

Gesture is on a mission to modernize and simplify gifting for consumers and B2B customers, while providing a great logistics experience and service for merchants and vendors. We are one of the newest on-demand companies on the market, we live out our company vision by helping to provide the solution to the age-old problem of overpriced and disappointing “gifting experiences.”

Gesture also has one of the most sophisticated logistics systems available in the on-demand industry which provides our vendors and merchants access to our G-Runners / fleet.

With Gesture, anyone can easily send flowers, wine, champagne and so much more from all across the nation starting at $25. Delivered in about an hour.

If you are looking to learn and/or expand your current knowledge skill set as a Javascript Developer Intern, we encourage you to apply to our EOIP (Early Opportunity Internship Program).

This internship program has a minimum twelve (12) week duration.

Responsibilities:

  • Developing user interface components and implementing them following well-known React.js workflows
  • Ensuring that the components and the overall application are robust and easy to maintain
  • Coordinating with the rest of the team working on different layers of the infrastructure
  • Building reusable components and front-end libraries for future use
  • Translating designs and wireframes into high-quality code
  • Optimizing components for maximum performance across a vast array of web-capable devices and browsers

Minimum Qualifications:

  • Thorough understanding of React.js and its core principles
  • Ability to understand business requirements and translate them into technical requirements
  • Experience with popular React.js workflows (such as Flux or Redux)
  • Strong proficiency in JavaScript, including DOM manipulation and the JavaScript object model
  • Experience with data structure libraries
  • Knowledge of modern authorization mechanisms, such as JSON Web Token
  • Familiarity with modern front-end build pipelines and tools
  • Experience with common front-end development tools such as Babel, Webpack, NPM, etc
  • Ability to understand business requirements and translate them into technical requirements
  • Familiarity with code versioning tools {such as Git, SVN, and Mercurial}

The technical publications internship offers the chance for students or recent graduates to get hands-on experience creating and managing content for the next generation of electric vehicles at Lucid. About GLOBALFOUNDRIES:

GLOBALFOUNDRIES is a leading full-service semiconductor foundry providing a unique combination of design, development, and fabrication services to some of the world’s most inspired technology companies. With a global manufacturing footprint spanning three continents, GLOBALFOUNDRIES makes possible the technologies and systems that transform industries and give customers the power to shape their markets. GLOBALFOUNDRIES is owned by Mubadala Investment Company. For more information, visit www.globalfoundries.com.

Summary of Role:

This internship is a software development project in the area of optical proximity correction (OPC) automation and is located at GLOBALFOUNDRIES' state of the art 300mm wafer fab in Malta, NY. The intern will be working on one or more of several project opportunities, including improving automation in OPC metrology, and automating optical proximity correction simulations.

Essential Responsibilities:

  • Ability to multitask
  • Perform all activities in a safe and responsible manner and support all Environmental, Health, Safety & Security requirements and programs

Required Qualifications:

  • Education – Pursuing a BS in Computer Science, Physics, Mathematics or other closely related engineering or physical science discipline
  • Experience – Strong object-oriented programming background with experience in python
  • Travel – Not required
  • Language Fluency – Fluency in English Language – (Written & Verbal)
  • Physical Capacity Demands – None

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Pursuing a MS or PhD in Computer Science, Physics, Mathematics or other closely related engineering or physical science discipline
  • Exposure to C++, object-oriented TCL, and database management
  • Experience working in a Linux cluster environment
  • Familiarity with the fundamentals of physics, optics, and semiconductor processing
  • An understanding of AGILE software development, and the Scrum AGILE framework

At CBORD/Horizon, our interns work on projects that matter – and your team will rely on your skills and insights to help deliver those projects to market. This is your chance to bring solutions and ideas to life while working on cutting-edge technology. We offer internships in all job families and solution areas, and it’s open to current students. Our interns work on meaningful projects spanning all solutions and services throughout the Company. Software Engineer Interns work with teammates to solve problems and build innovative software solutions.

The internship is designed not only for you to do great work with the opportunity to learn and grow, but to experience our culture full of diverse community connection, executive leadership, and memorable events.

We offer benefits designed to make your experience the best it can be. As an intern you will receive competitive pay and many other amazing perks. Imagine yourself as a CBORD/Horizon intern. Join our DREAMteam, and help us innovate and change the market.

Internship opportunities vary depending on education level and/or location. We offer internship roles in the following areas including but not limited to:

  • Engineering
  • UX Design
  • IT Operations
  • Marketing
  • Services & Support

What You’ll Be Doing

Software Engineer Interns work with teammates to solve problems and build innovative software solutions.

  • May be given tasks/requirements in all areas of software development and support based upon project and scheduling requirements.
  • Assignments will be defined specifically with the intention of allowing the individual to develop independent software engineering skills in the area of software maintenance and new development.
  • Where possible, assignments will become more complex as the individual demonstrates the ability to accept increasingly complex tasks.
  • Tools Used: PHP, Javascript, JQuery, XCode (iOS) Android OS, C/C++, Cloud/VM, VB Net, C#, Visual Basic, Windows, Oracle, Perl, Linux, PHP.
  • Actively participate in product planning and other requirements gathering.
  • Participate in special or customer-specific projects as assigned
  • Research and develop an understanding of the marketing requirements for the product, including how the product is actually used by our customers.

What You’ll Bring to the Table

You want to work on a meaningful and impactful project and make a difference. You are willing to learn from others and open to new ideas. You want to support others to succeed and operate in a highly-collaborative environment.

  • Passionate about software design and programming, capable of learning quickly and continuously; strong interest and curiosity in technology.
  • Good communication skills
  • Some experience building software preferred
  • Ability to apply basic test strategy knowledge and methodologies to design, develop, and execute general software tests.
  • Actively enrolled in a Bachelor’s Degree program in one of the following disciplines: Engineering, Computer Science, or business major with a technical minor.

Who We Are

CBORD and Horizon are the world’s leading providers of integrated technology solutions powering housing, access, foodservice, nutrition, eCommerce, and card systems for K-12 and higher education, acute care, senior living, and business campuses. Our success and growth is directly attributed to our DREAMteam. Our culture is built on integrity, respect for our people, and continuous personal development. We maintain an entrepreneurial spirit, where creativity, innovative problem solving, and learning agility drive our day-to-day actions.

This description is intended to be generic in nature. It is not intended to determine all specific duties and responsibilities of any particular position.

Job Description


Come intern with one of the largest engineering companies in the world!

Join us to help develop new technology in Intel’s Optane Group (IOG). Intel's unique Optane memory technology delivers industry leading low latency in both solid-state drive and persistent memory products, that are positioned to change how data is managed worldwide. You can learn more about Intel Optane here: https://www.intel.com/content/www/us/en/architecture-and-technology/optane-memory.html

During the Internship you will get real-world experience with ownership of projects from day one, as well as the opportunity to develop a network inside and outside of Intel.

You will specifically be responsible for the following activities including, but not limited to:

  • Performing customer issue reproduction and debug in Intel’s lab environment

  • Setting up systems for performance benchmark testing, including installing drives and RAID cards, setting BIOS configuration, installing OS, software, and benchmarking tools and databases.

  • Executing performance benchmarking of Intel servers, SSDs, and software.

  • Assembling and configuring new server platforms

  • Updating system BIOS and SSD firmware

The ideal candidate should demonstrate the following behavioral traits:

  • Self-motivated individual willing to take direction and deliver to schedule

  • Written and verbal English communication and interpersonal skills

  • Problem solving skills

  • Effective prioritization and time management skills

This is a 1-year internship, with a possibility of extension. The role will be full time during the summer and part time for the rest of the year.


Qualifications


You must possess the below minimum qualifications to be initially considered for this position. Preferred qualifications are in addition to the minimum requirements and are considered a plus factor in identifying top candidates. Experience listed below would be obtained through a combination of your schoolwork/classes/research and/or relevant previous job and/or internship experiences.

Minimum Qualifications:

  • Must be pursuing a bachelor’s degree in Computer Engineering, Computer Science or related field.

  • 6+ months of experience or equivalent coursework in the following areas:

    • Linux

    • Software/Script Development

    • Debugging

  • This position is not eligible for employment-based visa/immigration sponsorship. Intel sponsors individuals for employment-based visas for positions where we experience a shortage of US Workers. These skills shortage roles are typically STEM contributing positions requiring a master’s or PhD degree, or a bachelor’s degree with three years’ related job experience. This position does not qualify for Intel Sponsorship because it is either (1) a non-STEM contributing position, or (2) a STEM position that only requires a bachelor’s degree and less than three years’ experience.

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Experience with Customer Interfacing, Computer Hardware Setup, Enterprise/Cloud Environments, Caching Software, SSDs, NVMe, RAID, and Software Defined Storage

  • Experience in Project Management / Product Management / Product Marketing

Inside this Business Group


The Data Center Group (DCG) is at the heart of Intel’s transformation from a PC company to a company that runs the cloud and billions of smart, connected computing devices. The data center is the underpinning for every data-driven service, from artificial intelligence to 5G to high-performance computing, and DCG delivers the products and technologies—spanning software, processors, storage, I/O, and networking solutions—that fuel cloud, communications, enterprise, and government data centers around the world.

position: Embedded Software Engineering Intern – Fort Worth, TX
description:
Company Description


A world leader in the design and manufacture of avionics flight instruments, technologically sophisticated defense systems, homeland security solutions, and diagnostic medical instrumentation. Elbit Systems of America combines the close-knit teamwork and high visibility of a small company with the stability and resources only a large company can provide. Add in our employee-friendly corporate culture and you’ll see why joining ESA could be the best move of your career.


We are seeking an embedded software engineering intern who wants to be part of a team that is helping to provide solutions to our nation’s defense.


Job Description
  • Assist in the design, development, and test of embedded software
  • Assist in the delivery of high quality software design, documentation and implementation that meet defined requirements as well as support products throughout the life cycle
  • Collaborate with team members across multiple engineering disciplines including Systems, Electrical, and Firmware
  • Other duties as assigned by your supervisor

Qualifications


Mandatory Job Qualifications:

Applicants must have all of the following to be considered for this position:

  • Working towards a degree in Computer Engineering, Software Engineering, Electrical Engineering or related field
  • Knowledge with C and C++
  • Knowledge with microprocessor (single and/or multi-core) and microcontroller based designs
  • Knowledge with standard software practices such as requirements management, source control management, IDEs, unit testing, and code reviews
  • Strong interpersonal, verbal and written communication, and problem-solving skills required
  • Ability to work alone or on a team setting
  • Skilled in MS applications such as Excel, Word, and PowerPoint

Highly Desired Job Qualifications:

  • Familiar with other high level languages such as Python
  • Exposure to Simulink and/or MATLAB

Additional Information


  • Must be a current student enrolled in an Engineering degree program (Preferably Sophomore and above).

  • Must be able to work at least 20 hours per week.

  • Must be capable of obtaining Department of Defence security clearance: Must be a US Citizen

Job Description

Our interns and co-ops write real software and partner with a select group of experienced software development engineers, who both help and challenge them as they work on projects that matter to our customers.

Basic Qualifications:

  • Bachelor’s or Master’s degree program in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or related technical discipline with a focus on software development
  • Familiarity with C/C++ programming.
  • Experience with using git

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Experience in Systems programming with Linux and/or windows
  • Ability to effectively articulate technical challenges and solutions
  • Experience with TCP/IP
  • Experience with Android.

Role:

Design, development and test of Embedded Software for IoT devices.

Job Types: Full-time, Contract

Pay: $16.00 - $45.00 per hour

Schedule:

  • 8 hour shift

Education:

  • Bachelor's (Preferred)

Experience:

  • C: 3 years (Required)
  • Embedded Software: 2 years (Required)

Work Location:

  • One location

Work Remotely:

  • Temporarily due to COVID-19

Role and Responsibility:

The Full Stack Developer Intern is responsible for the design and coding of mobile, web-based and conversational experiences, from technical architecture and APIs to function according to product specifications. Fully versed in modern databasing, ideally thrives to create excellent user experiences, attention to detail visually and understands that “user-friendly” starts with a fast and reactive architecture that delivers immediate user delight. Understands the basics of data-driven product development and thrives in an ultra-fast, dynamic and iterative 24/7 global team.

Qualifications:

  • Databasing: an understanding of legacy SQL/RDBMS complemented with knowledge of NoSQL, map-reduce and graph databases and ability to bridge those worlds.
  • API: Ability to navigate effortlessly between SOAP and REST, speaks JSON fluently, understands the value of real-time, knows how to stitch front-end with back-end in no time
  • Web: Inner knowledge of React and Vue.
  • Mobile: iOS is a must, Android is ok
  • Creative: fully understands that user interfaces are critical for a product’s success. Basic understanding of design principles (ex: material), techniques and tools (ex: sketch) a definite plus
  • Understands usage data technologies such as Mixpanel and knows how to effectively track and report, either to humans via dashboard or ML engines
  • REACT knowledge and experience a must
  • Academic background: recently graduated or currently enrolled in a Master's Degree in Computer Science.
  • May require early morning or late night meetings to coordinate work assignments with our worldwide geographical development team.

Nice to have:

  • Data science and machine learning background in order to be able to understand effectively self-configuring software and usage-based UX/UI development, basic knowledge of math behind machine learning, neural networks, natural language processing, languages (python and python), frameworks (TensorFlow, torch, keanor, …)

Apply to start your career adventure with us!

Coursera was launched in 2012 by two Stanford Computer Science professors, Andrew Ng and Daphne Koller, with a mission to provide universal access to world-class learning. It is now one of the largest online learning platforms in the world, with 82 million registered learners as of March 31, 2021. Coursera partners with over 200 leading university and industry partners to offer a broad catalog of content and credentials, including Guided Projects, courses, Specializations, certificates, and bachelor’s and master’s degrees. More than 6,000 institutions have used Coursera to upskill and reskill their employees, citizens, and students, including in high-demand fields such as data science, technology, and business. Coursera became a B Corp in February 2021.

Coursera’s Engineering teams are responsible for maintaining a scalable and reliable platform. Engineering works to build interactive products for the worldwide learner community. As an engineer at Coursera, you will be empowered to build well-engineered products that shape new platform features and advance our technical infrastructure. You will be encouraged to build reliable, scalable, testable, and efficient systems.

During the 16-week internship, you'll be embedded as a member of a small Engineering team and paired with a mentor on your team. You will have the guidance, environment, and the responsibility of deploying your projects to production. You will work on real projects, features, and updates that will affect millions of learners worldwide!

This internship will run from August 30 - December 17. It will be fully remote, but you will need to work remotely from within the United States. We will begin reviewing applications on May 24.

Check out life at Coursera on The Muse!

Basic Qualifications:

    • Must be currently enrolled in a full time degree program and returning to the program after the completion of the internship

Preferred Qualifications:

    • Currently pursuing a B.A./B.S. Degree or higher in Computer Science, or related technical field
    • Strong competencies in data structures, algorithms and software design
    • Demonstrated software engineer experience via an internship, work experience, school projects or coding competitions.
    • Self-motivated, hands-on, focused on impact, and able to operate under a great deal of independence

Coursera is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer and considers all qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, marital status, national origin, protected veteran status, disability, or any other legally protected class.

If you are an individual with a disability and require a reasonable accommodation to complete any part of the application process, please contact us at accommodations@coursera.org.

Cuberg is commercializing a next-generation lithium metal battery to power the rise of electric mobility. Our battery technology provides huge benefits in terms of energy density, power, and safety, all in a format that allows for rapid scaling. Be part of a once-in-a-lifetime opportunity to transform the future of electric mobility.
We are currently seeking motivated Interns in the areas of materials science, engineering, data, and test. These positions require strong knowledge in chemistry, engineering, data, or science.
We are looking for candidates who have a passion for making an impact in our sustainable energy future and who will thrive in a rapidly evolving, close-knit, and dynamic early-stage startup environment. The ideal candidate will think independently, be unafraid to take on major responsibilities, and perform all tasks with diligence and care.
Join us in building the future of energy.
About
Cuberg is commercializing next-generation battery technology to power the future of electric mobility. The company was acquired in 2021 by Northvolt, a global supplier of sustainable, high-quality battery cells and systems. As Northvolt's Advanced Technology Center operating in Silicon Valley, Cuberg is developing and commercializing lithium metal batteries, building an innovation ecosystem around lithium-ion technology, and leveraging Northvolt's state-of-the-art manufacturing capabilities to rapidly scale up production of advanced batteries.
Responsibilities
Analyze experimental results to understand the impact of cell materials on cell performance
Assist scientists and engineers with material preparation, cell assembly, and testing
Prepare reports, present and share results with team members
Work closely with the battery modeling team members
Requirements
Currently pursuing a B.S., M.S. or Ph.D. degree in Computer Science, Mechanical Engineering, Chemical Engineering, Material Science, Electrical Engineering, Applied Math, Applied Physics, Chemistry, or related area
Fundamental knowledge of Li-ion cell electrochemistry and mechanisms
Strong background in mathematical modeling and data analysis
Excellent communication skills and team-oriented attitude
Comfortable with initiating and taking ownership of the projects
Advantageous Experience with Python and/or MATLAB
Experience in building and maintaining databases
Benefits
Paid time off, holidays

Cuberg is commercializing a next-generation lithium metal battery to power the rise of electric mobility. Our battery technology provides huge benefits in terms of energy density, power, and safety, all in a format that allows for rapid scaling. Be part of a once-in-a-lifetime opportunity to transform the future of electric mobility.
We are currently seeking motivated Interns in the areas of materials science, engineering, data, and test. These positions require strong knowledge in chemistry, engineering, data, or science.
We are looking for candidates who have a passion for making an impact in our sustainable energy future and who will thrive in a rapidly evolving, close-knit, and dynamic early-stage startup environment. The ideal candidate will think independently, be unafraid to take on major responsibilities, and perform all tasks with diligence and care.
Join us in building the future of energy.
About
Cuberg is commercializing next-generation battery technology to power the future of electric mobility. The company was acquired in 2021 by Northvolt, a global supplier of sustainable, high-quality battery cells and systems. As Northvolt's Advanced Technology Center operating in Silicon Valley, Cuberg is developing and commercializing lithium metal batteries, building an innovation ecosystem around lithium-ion technology, and leveraging Northvolt's state-of-the-art manufacturing capabilities to rapidly scale up production of advanced batteries.
Responsibilities
Analyze experimental results to understand the impact of cell materials on cell performance
Assist scientists and engineers with material preparation, cell assembly, and testing
Prepare reports, present and share results with team members
Work closely with the battery modeling team members

Currently pursuing a B.S., M.S. or Ph.D. degree in Computer Science, Mechanical Engineering, Chemical Engineering, Material Science, Electrical Engineering, Applied Math, Applied Physics, Chemistry, or related area
Fundamental knowledge of Li-ion cell electrochemistry and mechanisms
Strong background in mathematical modeling and data analysis
Excellent communication skills and team-oriented attitude
Comfortable with initiating and taking ownership of the projects
Advantageous Experience with Python and/or MATLAB
Experience in building and maintaining databases
Benefits
Paid time off, holidays

position: Harvest Intern at Mercer Wine Estates
description:
Mercer Wine Estates is looking for highly motivated Interns to join our team for the 2021 harvest season. Mercer Estates is a 70,000 case per year winery, located in Prosser, WA that produces both red and white varieties. In 2020, the winery expanded with the addition of a new custom crush facility located in the heart of the Horse Heaven Hills AVA where an expected 4500 tons will be processed this harvest for clients. During your internship, you will play a vital role helping our team process incoming fruit.

Duties to include:

· Vineyard fruit sample crushing and analysis

· Tank and truck sampling

· Tank analysis to include - temperature, brix, pH, TA, YAN, ML, and RS

· Daily tasting and evaluations of tanks and press wine

· Assist with nutrient and yeast additions

· Updating spreadsheets

· Aid in working truck scale software and processing

· Monitor CO2 throughout the facility

· Help cellar with any additional tasks as needed

Qualifications:

· Interest in wine making and wine production

· General Knowledge of fermentation science

· College level coursework in chemistry, including basic laboratory skills

· Good computer skills, proficient in Excel

· Good communication skills

· Attention to detail

· Safety minded

· Must be able to lift 50lbs

· Must have reliable transportation

Benefits:

  • Hourly wage depending on experience
  • Paid Sick Time Off- according to the State of Washington’s guidance
  • Medical Insurance
  • 401(k) retirement plan with employer match

position: Sales Intern - Education Sales / Sports Teams / Government Sales
description:
Title: Sales Intern – Education, Team, Military/Government Business Development

Reports to: Director of Education Sales / Director of Team, Military and Government Sales

Department: Education Sales / Sports Team & Government Sales

Job Status: Salaried Internship; paid on an hourly basis

Duration: Summer / Flexible

General Position Summary:

Polar Electro, Inc. is seeking a college student working towards a Bachelor’s degree in Business, Marketing, Physical Education, Exercise Science, or a related field.

Gain hands-on experience growing a business by identifying new leads, building sales databases, analyzing markets, and collaborating with sales and marketing leadership to drive excellence. These leads are prospects who may be interested in Polar B2B solutions connected to the Polar ecosystem.

Relative to Education, Polar solutions bring biometric monitoring and measurement to the world of physical education. This democratizes PE and empowers students and PE professionals to exceed their physical education goals dramatically.

Relative to the Team & Gov business, Polar solutions help reduce injury rates, improve team-group performance, and win more games.

After initial training, this position will primarily be remote with regular meetings with Managers.

Scope of Internship:

  • Collaborate with internal staff that will result in strategy development to secure new business.
  • Attend team sales phone meetings.
  • Perform online and social media research to identify and collect contact information for key players in Education, Team Sports, and Gov for market expansion. This includes but is not limited to school district administrators, educators, strength and conditioning coaches, sports coaches, athletic trainers, athletic directors, researchers, industrial hygienists, sports academies & training facilities, youth, high school, college, and pro sports administrators.
  • Interact on social media to build brand awareness for both EDU and Team/Gov.
  • Monitors key competitors through social media and reports to sales managers.
  • Generated lead lists must be provided to EDU & Team-Gov Sales managers in a timely fashion.
  • Analyzes business trends and determines opportunities for segment and account growth.
  • Demonstrates understanding of the Polar product line and pricing.
  • Along with contact information, learn how uncovering important information such as current and previous win-loss record, playoff history, box scores, budget and possible booster club/fundraising support efforts, notable alumni, etc., impact current and future business decisions.
  • Form cross-departmental partnerships with the marketing team to ensure promotions, events, tradeshows, and product demonstrations are effective.
  • Assist with order processing when needed to experience how a lead turns into a sale.
  • Assist with supporting customer calls/requests for information.
  • Assist with coordination and scheduling of customer training/education sessions

Potential candidates should possess the following:

  • Passion for sport and fitness and have knowledge of various levels of Physical Education and sports leagues/conferences.
  • Intrinsically motivated, capable of working independently/remotely, and have extensive experience with social media platforms
  • Excellent communication and presentation skills.
  • Proficient with Word/Excel/PowerPoint.
  • Excellent interpersonal skills to ensure a team-oriented culture
  • Ability to manage multiple tasks simultaneously.
  • Interest in technology and a passion for heart rate and performance training products.

Job Types: Full-time, Part-time, Temporary, Internship

Pay: $15.00 per hour

Benefits:

  • Flexible schedule
  • Paid training
  • Work from home

Schedule:

  • Monday to Friday

Polar Electro, Inc. employees work primarily remotely.

  • Are you able to operate a computer, perform internet searches and use the telephone to contact potential customers?
  • Candidate must be currently enrolled in a college or university to obtain this internship.

Work Location:

  • Fully Remote

Senior Intern positions provide the necessary training to potentially develop into a Senior Staff position. Typically, individuals can progress from a Senior Intern to a Senior Staff as they develop and gain experience through required training. Senior Interns are responsible for assessing the client’s current level of development across the various sections of the curriculum, designing the majority of the client programs, writing the Individual Treatment Plan (under the direction of the Clinical Supervisor and Lead Therapist), and providing most of the hands-on supervision for Behavior Technicians. Senior Intern responsibilities and caseloads systematically increase as training goals are met.

Essential Functions:
1. Completes required office and field training toward a Senior Staff position and demonstrates mastery with training goals.
2. Develops client-specific therapeutic treatment plans based on appropriate assessments and developmental guidelines.
3. In conjunction with supervisory staff and caregivers, develops programs appropriate to the current and future needs of the clients. Creates programs, moves targets forward, prepares program materials, and makes procedural changes as needed.
4. Designs and implements behavior observation systems, support plans, and intervention guidelines.
5. Coordinates the collection, summarization and analysis of data related to individual program goals and behavioral plans.
6. Consults with Behavior Technicians, caregivers, and supervisory staff to ensure that programming is adequate to meet the needs of the client.
7. Analyzes program data to ensure appropriate progress and effectiveness.
8. Develops and maintains weekly and monthly progress notes, reviews clinical documentation of Behavior Technicians, and updates treatment plans.
9. Completes appropriate assessments and probes new targets to determine future goals.
10. Communicates with parents, guardians or other caregivers concerning behavioral and educational programming.
11. Supervises, orients, and trains Behavior Technicians in the implementation of programs and behavioral intervention procedures, routinely providing ongoing coaching and feedback to enhance staff development and skill. Ensures Behavior Technician is oriented appropriately to the company and follows all policies and procedures.
12. Evaluates Behavior Technician performance and addresses issues to ensure quality and consistency across clinical programs.
13. Proactively addresses employee relation issues or concerns, including ongoing coaching and feedback, employee development, performance management, and if appropriate, disciplinary action.
14. May participate in weekly clinical team meetings to discuss case progress, address Behavior Technician and caregiver concerns, review individual program plans, and recommend revisions as necessary.
15. Provides verbal, written, and graphic communications.
16. Consults with supervisory staff to ensure the provision of effective and efficient service delivery.
17. Continually develops skills and knowledge in the area of behavior analysis through participation in continuing education, workshops, and required company trainings.
18. Follows and abides by all APA ethical guidelines and appropriate policies, regulations, and laws including confidentiality and HIPAA. Adheres to mandated reporting regulations.

Supervisory Responsibility: Supervises Behavior Technician on assigned client cases.

Physical Demands:
While performing the duties of this job, the employee may be exposed to a client who exhibits physically aggressive behavior which can include kicking, pinching, punching, biting, etc. The employee may have to use appropriate behavior management techniques frequently with a client under such circumstances. Such response requires agility, quick reflexes, and the ability to use physically evasive movement. The employee will be constantly required to stand, walk, sit, grasp, reach, bend, kneel, crouch, squat, hear, type and write. In addition, the employee will be exposed to normal office conditions and usual office equipment such as phone, computer, printers, copiers, files, etc. The employee must be able to independently and repeatedly lift, move and carry objects weighing up to thirty-five (35) pounds. Specific vision abilities required by this job include near, far, and field of vision. Speech must be spoken in a way in which others will understand. This position requires regular and punctual employee presence.

Qualifications:
Education:

  • A Bachelor’s Degree in a human services discipline or documentation of actively pursuing a Bachelor’s Degree in a human services discipline with anticipated graduation date within six months from initiation of internship and at least 1,500 hours of training or supervised experience in the use of behaviorally based therapy models consistent with best practice and research on the effectiveness for children with autism spectrum disorders who meet all criteria to receive this service, OR
  • A Bachelor’s Degree in a non-human services discipline and actively pursuing either a BCaBA, BCBA, or a Master’s Degree in a human services discipline with graduation/certification date within six months from initiation of internship, and at least 1,500 hours of training or supervised experience in the use of behaviorally based therapy models consistent with best practice and research on effectiveness for children with autism spectrum disorders who meet all criteria to receive this service, OR
  • A Board Certified Assistant Behavior Analyst (BCaBA) with a minimum of 400 hours of hands-on training in providing ABA services directly to children and/or adults with autism under the supervision of a Board-Certified Behavior Analyst who has at least two years of experience in ABA programming for individuals with autism, OR
  • Legal authorization to perform psychotherapy, with a Master’s Degree in one of the behavioral sciences who has at least 400 hours of training or supervised experience in the use of behaviorally-based therapy models consistent with best practice and research on effectiveness for children with autism spectrum disorders, in addition to, or as part of their 3,000 hours of training/supervision; and have sufficient written evidence of training and/or education in the method of evidence-based therapy being delivered, prior to the provision of services.

Experience:

  • Must have at least 1,500 hours’ experience working as a Behavior Technician implementing programs based on ABA principles.
  • Must have experience working with children and adolescents, utilizing ABA therapies.
  • A solid understanding of autism and behavioral principles.
  • Experience utilizing applied behavior analytic strategies to modify behavior.
  • Experience with functional behavior assessments and writing behavior support plans.

Other:

  • Must be 18 years old or older.
  • Must have a valid driver’s license and provide proof of auto insurance.

Job Type: Full-time

ESSENTIAL DUTIES/RESPONSIBILITIES:
  • Provide mental health counseling in a school setting and/or in our Axis Mental Health Counseling Clinic. May provide various types of counseling services to potentially include individual, group, family, couples, etc.
  • Will counsel individual from various cultural, ethnic, financial backgrounds, and will have the opportunity to work with children/teen, adults, and older adults.
  • Collaborate and consult with Axis licensed clinicians, medical doctors, case managers and other staff as necessary. Collaborate care with the contacts at the schools and with parents as necessary/directed.
  • Compete necessary documentation - using an electronic records system. Ensure charting and documentation is consistent with related laws and regulations, and Axis standards. Documentation includes appropriate medi-cal billing and is also overseen by supervisor.
  • Participates in peer review of clients' charts as directed.
  • This position takes place through the school year, with the potential to stay on during the summer, although as approved by suupervisor, and likely at decreased hours.
  • Attend one hour individual supervision weekly
  • Attend two hour group supervision weekly - mandatory. Occurs Wed morning from 10:00am-12:00pm. Present cases as needed/required and participate in discussion
  • Attend weekly one hour training. These trainings are conducted by Axis licensed therapists on a variety of topics. Interns will present on one topic one time during the intern year.
  • Perform other duties as assigned.
REQUIRED COMPETENCIES:
  • Ability to interact effectively and in a supportive manner with persons of all backgrounds.
  • Demonstrated ability to work independently and as part of a collaborative treatment team.
  • Good communication skills, ability to multi-task, good documentation skills..
  • Experience working in a school or clinic setting is a plus
  • Experience or training in cultural sensitivity and working with clients from a variety of different backgrounds
  • Ability to interact effectively and in a supportive manner with persons of all backgrounds.
QUALIFICATIONS:
  • Must hold a master’s degree in Psychology, Social Work or related field
  • Must be a registered intern with the California Board of Behavioral Sciences, the Board of Psychology, or currently enrolled in a Master’s or Doctorate degree program working as a trainee or practicum student.
  • Must Maintain a current registration or school enrollment in go good standing and must notify supervisor of any disciplinary action, including suspension or probation.

BENEFITS:
  • Employer paid health, dental, and vision benefits to the employee.
  • Option to participate in a 403(B) retirement plan with employer matching contribution.
  • Partial educational reimbursement.
  • 12 paid holidays.
  • Accrued paid time off with each pay period.
  • Employee discount programs.
  • License renewal fee reimbursement
  • Continuing Medical Education (CME) reimbursement program
  • Colleague Referral Bonus Program

Your profile: Application Programming Intern

  • Experience in mobile application development in any general-purpose programming language. This does not have to be strictly in a professional capacity. Applicants are encouraged (preferred) to demonstrate their ability with examples of completed projects.

Ability to triage and iterate application features quickly and have a solid understanding of industry-accepted debugging/testing/troubleshooting methodologies.

  • General understanding of UI/UX design principles. Ease and enjoyment of use is as important, if not slightly more so, than core app functionality.

Your responsibilities

Your opportunities for personal growth

  • Play a foundational role in the growth and development of a “tech startup” project within a leading energy technology company.

  • As a key team member, you will gain experience working directly with senior business and engineering professionals at Siemens Energy.

LET’S TALK ABOUT US

"Let’s make tomorrow different today" is our genuine commitment at Siemens Energy to all customers and employees on the way to a sustainable future.

In our Business Functions we enable our organization to reach their targets by providing best-in class services and solutions in the areas of IT, HR, Finance, Real Estate, Strategy & Technology and more.

Greenspace is a technology startup project from the Siemens Energy Incubator with the goal of disrupting how companies highlight their green and sustainable initiatives and acquire top talent. We want to become the “matchmaker” between companies and job seekers by revolutionizing the job search process. The goal is to have the feel of a dating app, but for employers and prospective employees, by creating a streamlined and interactive way to align values and determine fit. The project has received seed funding and is now ready to be developed and beta tested. This phase of the project is focused on achieving the following goals: 1) rapidly develop an MVP for release, 2) acquire initial users for beta testing (early adopters), and 3) iterate, iterate, iterate. Greenspace is an exciting opportunity to have the full flexibility of a tech startup supported by the resources of a global energy technology corporation.

MORE INSIGHTS

Be Energized. Be you.

Lucky for us, we are not all the same. Through diversity we generate power. We run on inclusion and compassion. Our combined creative energy is fueled by at least 130 nationalities. Siemens Energy celebrates character – no matter what ethnic background, gender, age, religion, identity, or disability. We energize society. All of society.

Overview:
NV5 (NASDAQ: NVEE) is a provider of engineering and consulting services to public and private sector clients, delivering solutions through six business verticals: Testing, Inspection & Consulting; Infrastructure; Utility Services; Environmental Health Sciences; Buildings & Program Management; and Geospatial Technology. With offices nationwide and abroad, NV5 helps clients plan, design, build, test, certify, and operate projects that improve the communities where we live and work.

As engineers, architects, construction/program managers, environmental professionals and beyond, we play a significant role in shaping our communities through the services we provide. We are looking for passionate, driven individuals to join our team focused on Delivering Solutions and Improving Lives.

Responsibilities:
Job Summary:
Assist engineers and designers in the development and production of engineering plans and specifications on a variety of projects. The systems designed at NV5 include Electrical, HVAC, and Fire Protection and Plumbing systems for a wide variety of building types.

  • Lay out engineering drawings using AutoCAD/Revit. Transfer the design from verbal or written instructions to CAD/Revit under the supervision of an engineer, senior engineer or project manager.
  • Take engineer’s rough plan mark-ups and modify or finalize design documents using AutoCAD/Revit.

  • May assist with engineering calculations as directed by engineering staff.

  • Must be working towards a BS Degree in Engineering
  • Formal training in AutoCAD and Revit preferred.
  • Must have excellent verbal and written communication skills along with familiarity with Microsoft Products such as Excel and Outlook.

The job is performed primarily in an indoor office environment with occasional driving to commercial and institutional job site locations and outdoor activities at the site (including mechanical rooms, rooftops, and buildings). The employee frequently sits or stands in the same location with opportunity to move about; occasionally walks substantial distances at job site locations; regularly thinks, concentrates, analyzes, interprets, interacts with others, and communicates orally and in writing; regularly uses a computer (keyboard and mouse); regularly reads, sees, hears, and speaks; frequently uses hands to write, type, finger, handle, or feel; occasionally reaches with hands and arms; occasionally bends, stoops, and lifts or moves up to 30 pounds (and greater weights infrequently); occasionally climbs ladders and stairs.

Job Description

At Citadel Securities, Software Engineers design, develop, and maintain the advanced technology that powers our firm and allows us to challenge the impossible in trading.

As an intern, you’ll get to challenge the impossible in technology through an 11 week program that will allow you to collaborate and connect with senior team members and our CEO Peng Zhao. In addition, you’ll get the opportunity to network and socialize with peers at iconic venues.

Your Objectives:

· Create technological tools that bring trading strategies to life

· Develop high-performance, large data research platforms

· Work in small teams to build the future of finance

Your Skills & Talents:

Opportunities available in Chicago, New York, London

About Citadel Securities

Citadel Securities is a leading global market maker across a broad array of fixed income and equity securities. Our world-class capabilities position us to meet the liquidity demands of our diverse group of institutional clients in all market conditions. The team makes its mark every day from our offices around the world: Chicago, New York, London, Hong Kong, Toronto, Shanghai, Sydney, Dublin.
