The Hardware and Home Improvement (HHI) business of Spectrum Brands is a major manufacturer and supplier of residential locksets, residential builders' hardware, faucets, and commercial locksets and doors, with a portfolio of renowned brands, including Kwikset®, Weiser®, Baldwin®, National Hardware®, Stanley®, FANAL®, Pfister™, EZSET®, and Tell. HHI is a leader in its key markets with #1 positions in U.S. residential locksets (Kwikset), Canada residential locksets (Weiser), U.S. luxury locksets (Baldwin), and U.S. builders' hardware (Stanley-National Hardware), #2 in Mexico residential hardware (Fanal), #3 in U.S. retail plumbing (Pfister), and #1 in U.S. retail commercial locksets. Headquartered in Orange County, California, HHI has a global sales force and operates manufacturing and distribution facilities in the U.S., Canada, Mexico and Asia.


Job Summary


We are looking for a highly motivated and practical candidate to support the engineering requirements of Mobile Software Engineering for the Kwikset, Baldwin, and Weiser product brands.

Working closely with Senior Mobile Software Engineer, the Mobile Software Engineer Intern will design, build, and support smart lock applications for iOS and/or android platform. You will collaborate with the cross functional team to define and design the apps. You will develop, test, maintain, and enhance mobile applications, ensuring quality and performance of the application to specifications. At the end or your internship, you will present your accomplishments and results to the Engineering Leadership team.

This position requires a 40-hour work week (8 hours per day) and can be partially remote and partially onsite 2-3 days per week in our Lake Forest office for the duration of the internship.


Primary Duties & Responsibilities
  • (40%) Collaborate with fellow mobile developers to analyze, design, develop, integrate, customize, build, test, debug, and enhance existing and new apps.
  • (20%) Ensure mobile apps works right, every time, by using testing, continuous integration, and in-depth code reviews.
  • (10%) Make important coding architecture decisions and participate in code reviews. Refactor the code to use best practices if necessary.
  • (10%) Work in an Agile Software Development Life Cycle and contribute to the overall development process flow
  • (10%) Completing project deliverables and action items per schedule.
  • (5%) Contribute to the success of your team's projects and development
  • (5%) Presentation support: assist in creating presentation models and materials for engineering and executive review.


Education and Experience Profile
  • 2nd, 3rd or 4th year Computer Science / Software Engineering Student or recent graduate
  • Successful completion of coursework in Computer Architecture and Networks, Software Modeling and Design, and Data Structures and Algorithms is preferred


Required Skills
  • Project experience building mobile apps for Android or iOS.
  • Programming experience in one or more object-oriented languages, including: Kotlin, Swift, Java, Objective-C, C++.
  • Strong competencies in software design, problem solving, testing, and debugging, and contribute with a great deal of independence.
  • Understanding of code versioning tools, such as Git, is a plus.
  • The ability to collaboratively work within a team environment and consistently make contributions to help the team reach their objectives.
  • Knowledge of Microsoft Outlook, Excel, PowerPoint and Word. Knowledge of MS Project is a plus.
  • Effective written and verbal communication skills with various levels of corporate structure.
  • Self-starter attitude and proficient in managing multiple assignments.


Work Environment


Working conditions are normal for an office environment. The candidate will be working in a design (computer), testing lab, and a mobile software development workstation. Opportunities to interface with members from cross-functional teams such as engineering, marketing, industrial design, and manufacturing.

Spectrum Brands is an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer.

High school intern at KBI Biopharma (Summer 2021)
About this role:
KBI Biopharma is looking for an intern to join the cell culture process development team. The intern will be responsible for conducting remote (virtual only) data analysis and presenting data analysis. No active lab work will be performed during this internship. Main responsibilities will include:
  • Compare antifoam addition data between different bioreactor scales across 3-5 cell lines to identify scale dependency
  • Summarize findings from antifoam addition comparison in 15-minute presentation to the upstream cell culture team
  • Perform data entry for 30 completed cGMP manufacturing bioreactor runs with a goal to develop process output database
  • Learn basics of biologics manufacturing
Outcomes:
  • Be able to describe antifoam addition for various production bioreactor scales with basic statistics
  • Become familiar with the mechanism of foam formation and use of antifoam in a mammalian cell culture production process
  • Learn about importance of process database development and data mining
Essential skills:
  • Enthusiasm and willingness to learn and ask questions
  • Able to multitask, prioritize, and manage time efficiently
  • Good interpersonal skills and communication
  • Good computer skills (Microsoft Excel, Word and PowerPoint)
If you are interested in this position, please send your resume in pdf format to jkim@kbibiopharma.com or nbubna@kbibiopharma.com from 26th April to 07th May 2021. Interested students will be contacted for 15-minute virtual interviews in May 2021.
About KBI Biopharma:
KBI Biopharma is a fast-growing, Science-Driven and Customer-Focused contract development & manufacturing organization (CDMO) serving the global biopharmaceutical industry. KBI’s business model is designed from the ground up to help clients accelerate their path to market while reducing risk and building value. Our customers range from small biotech to global biopharmaceutical companies as well as academic and non-profit organizations. In every client testimonial we’ve received and in every client survey we’ve seen, we are proud to report that KBI is viewed as the most collaborative and responsive of all the CDMOs with whom our clients work.
KBI has an extensive track record of success in developing robust and scalable processes for cGMP manufacturing for a wide range of recombinant proteins for our clients. The Company has proven expertise in developing upstream and downstream processes, analytics and formulations, scale-up, technology transfer, and cGMP manufacture of protein-based therapeutics for pre-clinical and clinical manufacturing, process optimization and characterization, process performance qualification, and commercial launch production. To date, we have served over 250 clients globally.
The mammalian cell culture laboratories and pilot-scale operations are state-of-the-art. Single-use bioreactors ranging from 15 mL to 200 L are employed for process development and tech transfer projects. Well characterized ambr15 and ambr250 bioreactors from Sartorius along with the Xcellerex Single-use bioreactors (XDR-50 and XDR-200) are used as the mainstay of mammalian cell culture process development at KBI. High throughput equipment like Bio HT (Roche), Vi-CELL and blood gas analyzers are used for offline testing of cell culture samples.

About us

Geeks Unleashed

We are looking for a developer who is looking to grow their skills and resume. We are needing to create a dashboard for our company to have multiple functions. The main thing is the collection of data through API.

To Develop an application that will serve as an interface for end-users to understand their revenue and opportunities as well as a tool to help Geeks Unleashed by making it easier to reach their client base and to assist with accounting for sales made. Will have connections (API) to Shopify (and Vendors integrated with Shopify) that will allow data relevant to end-users and Company to be pulled, displayed, and filtered. Including accumulative sales, tax, and orders made. “Design Template” will Include a template for end-users to submit their own merch designs based on provided clothing templates that will be sent to Company's provided email. Provide a checkout system based on additional service choices that will allow for one-time purchases as well as monthly/yearly subscriptions. Ability to provide payouts from Company Paypal account directly to user's payment preference in their account settings.

We are looking to have this application off the ground as quickly as possible. With this in mind, we want to prioritize the design of the application, integration with Shopify and accounting aspects first and foremost.

Design – Completing the Home Page of the Dashboard. Theme, working integrations with Shopify showing the corresponding user’s accumulative revenue, past revenue by month and current revenue for the month. Links for “Geeks Tier Subscription” services integrated (Link leading to application page, will be provided).

Shopify Integration – Making the needed connections to Shopify’s API to pull relevant information, such as over-all Company Sales, ability to filter revenue, tax and profit.

Accounting – Ability to calculate all sales, taxes incurred, profit and function to export via csv, xcl or html format.

Ultimately, we are looking to have a web-based application developed that will allow our users to have a high-view of their profit and revenue, send out announcements and offer tools to expand their platform. At the same time, we would like for this application to allow us an easier way to calculate sales and tax to alleviate some of the more tedious calculations that we have to do on the backend, keep in contact with our users via announcements.

Supply Chain Analytics Intern

Posting Number: #175-21

Position Title: Supply Chain Analytics Intern

Closing Date: Until Filled

Location: Washington, DC


Apply Here

SUSTAINING TECHNICAL AND ANALYTIC RESOURCES

INTERN TITLE: Supply Chain Analytics Intern
HOST ORGANIZATION: Strategic Information/Knowledge Management Team Supply Chain for Health Division, Office of HIV/AIDS, Global Health Bureau, United States Agency for International Development
LOCATION: Washington DC/Virtual due to COVID-19
POSITION LEVEL: Masters
INT-P3-XXX
SALARY: $1,868.66 bi-weekly (exempt, salaried position)
ANTICIPATED TIMEFRAME: 6 Months, full-time

STAR PROGRAM DESCRIPTION
Sustaining Technical and Analytic Resources (STAR) is a project of the Public Health Institute (PHI) in partnership with the Johns Hopkins University (JHU) and the University of California, San Francisco (UCSF), supported by the US Agency for International Development (USAID). STAR is a Global Health talent hub. Through fellowships, internships, and strategic partnerships, STAR supports building the capacity of diverse global health professionals and organizations at all levels to make inclusive, collaborative, and innovative contributions to global health. STAR participants collaborate in the development of systems and tools that strengthen and sustain the local and global health response.

INTERNSHIP DESCRIPTION
Background:
USAID procures and distributes over $1B in health pharmaceuticals and supplies every year and invests over $200M annually to strengthen supply chains in developing countries. With over 100 points of origin, over 50 destination countries, more than 4000 SKUs and hundreds of shipments a year, the amount of data generated from its supply chain operation is significant. In addition, there is data residing in multiple country systems and many other data sources that can further support USAID’s supply chain program. USAID is in the process of bringing online a data warehouse and business intelligence tool to house and use these disparate datasets in the management of its supply chain programs and investments.

Introduction:
The Supply Chain for Health Division within the Office of HIV/AIDS in the Bureau of Global Health is seeking a Supply Chain Analytics Intern (Intern) to assist the team (1) to evaluate the quality of critical datasets, (2) contribute to the design of solutions to address the root causes of missing and erroneous data, (3) to contribute to the design strategic reports and dashboards to support key management units within USAID Global Health, and (4) to identify business process improvement opportunities centered around the newly developing analytics platform.

Reporting structure:
The Intern will work closely with the Strategic Information/Knowledge Management team and receive technical guidance from the SCH Division Chief, who will serve as their Point of Contact.

OUTCOMES
By the end of the internship, the Intern will have gained experience and exposure to:

  • Understanding of global health supply chain data, data mapping processes and standards, core supply chain processes, business intelligence tools, dashboarding and analytics.
  • Skills in collaboration and coordination within a complex organizational and implementation structure.
  • Experience working on analytics projects contributing to the creation of a new data warehouse and business intelligence tool for international datasets.

Essential Duties:

  • Work with the Strategic Information/Knowledge Management team (SIKM) to develop an analytics project to advance OHA’s understanding and use of supply chain data, relying heavily on work in R, Python, or other open-source statistical packages.
  • Support the development of routine and ad-hoc analysis using 20+ supply chain datasets for data quality, contributing to the identification of root causes of error through data analysis, business process review, and stakeholder interviews.
  • Assist in recommending solutions to improve overall data quality (changes in processes, input automation, input masks, etc.).
  • Work with key personnel across the organization to design dashboards and reports to provide decision support and enable more efficient, effective and strategic management.

Anticipated learning outcomes:
All STAR Interns will participate in learning activities (*approximately 10% time) during their internship. By the end of the internship, the Intern will be able to:

  • Gain exposure to data analytics and supply chain data/knowledge management through global health programming.
  • Apply effective communication skills across a broad network of peers and advisors within global health to support learning and professional development.

INTERNSHIP REQUIREMENTS
Required:

  • Currently enrolled masters or other post-bachelor’s degree candidate or completion of such within the past 12 months related to supply chain management, business, information systems, computer science or related field.
  • Proficiency in R, Python or another open-source statistical package.
  • Professional or academic experience with global health, data analytics, supply chain management, procurement, and/or logistics for a large organization and/or HIV programs.
  • Ability to analyze data from different sources/databases utilizing multiple data analytic platforms.
  • Ability to create and present data visuals.
  • Strong interpersonal, facilitation and team-building skills, and ability to work cross-culturally with diverse teams.
  • Demonstrated innovative thinking and problem-solving skills.
  • Excellent analytical, written and oral communication skills.
  • This position may require travel. Ability to participate in a field experience, which may involve domestic and/or international travel and overnight stays for up to 2 weeks pending lifting of COVID-19 travel restrictions.
  • US citizenship or US permanent residency required.

Preferred (not required):

  • Academic or professional experience working with dashboards/knowledge management tools.

SALARY AND BENEFITS

  • The Public Health Institute offers a comprehensive benefits package including learning programs.

TO APPLY

  • All applicants are required to apply for this position through STAR’s online recruitment system at recruitment.ghstar.org, which allows you to create a profile and upload a CV/resume and cover letter.

To this end, the PHI will not discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment because of race, color, sex, religion, national origin, ancestry, age, marital status, pregnancy, medical condition including genetic characteristics, physical or mental disability, veteran status, gender identification and expression, sexual orientation, and will take affirmative action to ensure that applicants are offered employment and employees are treated during employment without regard to these characteristics.

QinetiQ Inc. is a leading innovator with over 25 years of experience rapidly developing advanced C5ISR sensor solutions and is a renowned world leader in robotics and autonomy.

Quantcast is hiring Software Engineering Interns to join our engineering teams in our San Francisco office.
As the real-time pulse of the Internet, Quantcast runs the world’s largest AI-driven insights and measurement platform directly quantifying over 100 million web destinations. You’ll have the opportunity to learn software engineering best practices and own projects from start to finish with teams that specialize in machine Learning, distributed storage systems, big data platforms, API development and data visualization.

    • You will engage with executives and industry leaders through intern and company wide events. We believe in order to grow and be successful having access to all resources is key!
    • You will participate in fun and memorable events with fellow interns, mentors, and full-timers. Past events have included Cable Car Trolley Tours, volunteering, CAL Academy, scavenger hunts, and Giants games. While we do work hard we love to have fun!
    • We offer perks, which include intern housing stipend, snacks and drinks, catered lunches, dinners & weekly happy hours

Requirements

    • Excellent command of one or more programming languages: Java, C++ or Python

Mimic Technologies, Inc, is looking for a skilled and motivated Software Engineering Intern to join our growing software team and help implement our next generation of medical simulation technology. Job Details

Summer 2022 Intern - Software Engineer (Security)

This is your time to shine. Our software engineering interns are considered full-time employees by their peers. In fact, you will be expected to contribute right away as a member of our Engineering teams for future releases. As the world leader in enterprise cloud computing, we release 3 new versions every year with close to 100 new features each release. You will write code that reaches millions of subscribers who use a number of our applications ranging from Marketing Cloud, Service Cloud and Security to just name a few. Additionally, you will work on our automated testing infrastructure and craft the tools that provide real-time monitoring of our service. With such a quick turnaround, we don’t want our interns to sit on the sidelines and enjoy the view— we want you to change the way our customers connect their business to the world!

Have no experience in building security products? As long as you have solid Java software engineering skills and the passion for the security niche, we will give you the tools to succeed! position: Computer Science/Electrical Engineering Development Summer Intern V
description:
About our group:

We lead Seagate's consumer product division focusing on next-gen data storage and user experience.

About the role - you will:

Areas of Interest: NVMe, USB3.1 Gen 1/2, Thunderbolt, SATA, SAS, Fiber Channel, 10G Ethernet, RAID, Debug, System Performance Test, Python

Are you an Electrical Engineering, Computer Science or Computer Engineering undergrad student seeking an exciting summer 2021 internship and looking for an opportunity to leave a lasting impression in the consumer space?

We are looking for students ready to roll up their sleeves and help build game-changing products over the course of a 12 week summer internship at our Fremont Research Center. We are looking for students excited to help solve big problems and join a team with equally motivated co-workers. This is an awesome opportunity to work on early stage product development, solving real consumer issues. Responsibilites include:

  • Have the opportunity to help develop, test, and debug our cutting edge Consumer Electronic and Data Center Products
  • Help to characterize system performance and usage models for various storage technologies, propose methods to optimize data throughput
  • Support Research activities for other Advanced Development projects

Our summer interns typically work Monday thru Friday 8am to 5pm. The hours are subject to change with or without notice at the sole discretion of Seagate. Weekly communications with overseas design teams may be necessary.


About you:

Our ideal intern candidate must be a self-directed team player who thrives in a continually changing environment and has the following attributes and experience:
  • Currently pursuing a Bachelor’s or Master’s Degree in Electrical Engineering, Computer Science or Computer Engineering and returning to school in fall 2021
  • Excellent oral and written communication skills and the ability to work well in a team environment are essential to succeed in this role.
  • Great interpersonal skills and the ability to build consensus is a must
  • Excellent analytical and debug skills
  • Strong Electrical/Computer Engineering fundamentals with demonstrated ability to apply these skills to solve difficult real world problems
  • Experience with Network System Performance Testing and Script Writing a plus
  • Experience with various OS such as Linux, Unix, Windows and MacOS a plus
  • Experience with NVMe, USB3.1 Gen 1/2, Thunderbolt, SATA, Debug, System Test a plus
  • Experience with high speed interfaces and Hardware Testing a plus


Location:

Location: Fremont, CA

Our Gold LEED-certified Fremont product-design campus drives innovation, bringing together a diverse set of engineering, design, operations, support and administrative teams. The site is equipped with state-of-the-art clean room and lab space. On-site social activities are popular, including our annual BBQ, ice cream social, and holiday events. Wellness programs, gaming rooms and the on-site fitness center help round out and balance your Seagate work-life experience, along with opportunities to give back to our local community.

position: EDG Intern - Bachelor Computer Science Majors

Looking for Fall 2021 Interns!

Interns in our Engineering Development Group gain hands-on experience in a welcoming environment that fosters and rewards innovation, teamwork, learning, and fun. Belonging to the Professional Services (PS) department, our Functional team is divided in tree parts: Support, Quickstart and Projects. After a one-month training period, you will possibly go through the tree steps in your evolution, getting more and more varied experiences and skills.

Odoo consultants have different roles: you could be in charge of writing training material, giving training sessions to our customers or even helping colleagues on the first line support.

Our Odoo technical consultants improve day by day the tool and set of features using the best proffessional techniques.

But your main role remains to manage implementation projects and new features from A to Z:

Your main contacts will be with Technical Officers or CEO's in SME's. Your role will then consist on giving them explanations about the use of Odoo apps and making the follow-up. Usually each consultant is in charge of approximately 10 projects.

position: SAP Ariba iXp Intern - Full Stack Developer
description:
Requisition ID: 276489
Work Area: Software-Design and Development
Expected Travel: 0 - 10%
Career Status: Student
Employment Type: Intern


COMPANY DESCRIPTION


SAP started in 1972 as a team of five colleagues with a desire to do something new. Together, they changed enterprise software and reinvented how business was done. Today, as a market leader in enterprise application software, we remain true to our roots. That’s why we engineer solutions to fuel innovation, foster equality and spread opportunity for our employees and customers across borders and cultures.

SAP values the entrepreneurial spirit, fostering creativity and building lasting relationships with our employees. We know that a diverse and inclusive workforce keeps us competitive and provides opportunities for all. We believe that together we can transform industries, grow economics, lift up societies and sustain our environment. Because it’s the best-run businesses that make the world run better and improve people’s lives.

About the SAP Internship Experience Program:


The SAP Internship Experience Program is SAP’s global, paid internship program that provides university students with the opportunities to find purpose in their careers.

Three reasons to intern at SAP:

1. Culture of collaboration: Meet with mentors, make new friends across the globe and create a thriving personal network.
2. Project-driven experience: Gain cross-functional skills from our virtual and in-person learning sessions, diverse subject matter experts, and project deliverables.
3. Gain visibility: With SAP Internship Experience Program in your title, you’ll have a global network of SAP leaders, entrepreneurs and career development opportunities at your fingertips.


About the team:
The Supply Chain Collaboration team is one of the fastest growing teams within the SAP Business Network, the largest business-to-business network in the world with over 3.6 million connected companies in over 190 countries. Our solution enables customers to manage and run an efficient supply chain and helps them collaborate with direct materials suppliers through innovative planning and execution processes. We are looking for bright engineers who are passionate about solving complex business problems with purposeful and beautiful software and have fun while doing it.


What you’ll do:

Position Title: SAP Ariba iXp Intern – Full Stack Developer
Location: Palo Alto, CA
Expected start date to end date: June 2021 – August 2021


In this role, you’ll:
  • Have the unique opportunity to work on innovation/prototyping projects that will enhance the Supply Chain Collaboration offering
  • Design and develop pixel-perfect UI, robust APIs, and scalable microservices for the cloud
  • Gain insight in how enterprise customers manage and run their supply chain on the SAP Business Network


Who you are:

We’re looking for someone who takes initiative, perseveres, and stays curious. You like to work on meaningful innovative projects and are energized by lifelong learning.


  • Candidates must be currently enrolled in an undergraduate or graduate degree program in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or equivalent
  • Strong desire to revolutionize the enterprise application space by building beautiful and purposeful cloud solutions for business users
  • Strong programming skills in Java, JavaScript, SQL, CSS
  • Strong analytical and communication skills, ability to articulate technical challenges and solutions clearly
  • Thrive in a fast-paced environment working with multiple teams across various geographies
  • Preferred experience: familiarity with Angular, Microservices (Springboot), Kafka, JIRA, IntelliJ IDEA, JMeter, Jenkins, Github


WHAT YOU GET FROM US

Success is what you make it. At SAP, we help you make it your own. A career at SAP can open many doors for you. If you’re searching for a company that’s dedicated to your ideas and individual growth, recognizes you for your unique contributions, fills you with a strong sense of purpose, and provides a fun, flexible and inclusive work environment – apply now.

SAP'S DIVERSITY COMMITMENT
To harness the power of innovation, SAP invests in the development of its diverse employees. We aspire to leverage the qualities and appreciate the unique competencies that each person brings to the company.

SAP is committed to the principles of Equal Employment Opportunity and to providing reasonable accommodations to applicants with physical and/or mental disabilities. If you are in need of accommodation or special assistance to navigate our website or to complete your application, please send an e-mail with your request to Recruiting Operations Team (Americas: Careers.NorthAmerica@sap.com or Careers.LatinAmerica@sap.com, APJ: Careers.APJ@sap.com, EMEA: Careers@sap.com).

Successful candidates might be required to undergo a background verification with an external vendor.

Additional Locations: Virtual - USA

The Bosch Center for Artificial Intelligence (BCAI) was founded in early 2017 to deploy cutting-edge AI technologies across Bosch products and services creating solutions that are "Invented for life." This position will be in the BCAI team in Sunnyvale, CA. In this intern role, you will explore, exploit, and invent the state-of-the-art computer vision and deep learning technologies. By leveraging big and unique dataset among Bosch business units, you will solve challenging industrial computer vision problems that will be adopted in the practical applications within Bosch. Company Description


The Bosch Research and Technology Center North America with offices in Sunnyvale, California, Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania and Cambridge, Massachusetts is part of the global Bosch Group (www.bosch.com), a company with over 70 billion euro revenue, 400,000 people worldwide, a very diverse product portfolio, and a history of over 125 years. The Research and Technology Center North America (RTC-NA) is committed to providing technologies and system solutions for various Bosch business fields primarily in the areas of Human Machine Interaction (HMI), Robotics, Energy Technologies, Internet Technologies, Circuit Design, Semiconductors and Wireless, and MEMS Advanced Design.


Job Description


Bosch Research is looking for an intern in atomistic computational materials science to join the materials design team. Our goal is to enable improved Bosch products through deep understanding of thermodynamic, kinetic, and transport phenomena on an atomic level using both quantum and classical simulations. Strong focus is placed on development and application of computational and machine-learning methods for understanding and automated discovery of next-generation materials, primarily for electrochemistry and energy conversion.

In this particular position, the intern will focus on studying the kinetics of water diffusion and water uptake in polymeric systems. Advanced atomistic methods will be employed to investigate degradation mechanisms and their impact on the polymeric system's static/dynamic mechanical properties. This work is relevant for the development of the diverse polymer materials portfolio of Bosch.

As part of Bosch Corporate Research, we are dedicated to long-term fundamental investigations of transformative energy technologies. Located in Cambridge, close to MIT and Harvard, our materials computation team supports global experimental efforts with fundamental understanding, emphasizing innovation and high technological impact. Using both internal funding and government grants, we collaborate closely with a network of leading computational and experimental teams which includes top universities, national labs and industrial partners. We strongly encourage high-impact publications and patent applications.


Qualifications


Required Qualification:

  • Ph.D. candidate at a top university in chemical engineering, physics, chemistry, materials science, or a related field.
  • Solid foundations in materials science, solid-state physics, and/or chemistry
  • Attention to detail, flexibility, creativity, and excellent communication and teamwork skills

Desired Qualification:

  • Experience in atomistic simulations, preferably density-functional theory, molecular dynamics, and/or quantum chemistry
  • Significant research and/or coding experience, preferably with fluency in Python and FORTRAN/C++
  • Strong background in physics and coding, and passion on working and understanding physics-based devices

Additional Information


Duration: 14 weeks (est.)

  • AWIM (A World in Motion)

Bluecadet is an award-winning, internationally-recognized experience design agency focused on producing transformative digital products and environments. Past clients include Google, MoMA, Harvard, Comcast, Princeton, The Smithsonian Institution, Doctors Without Borders, National Geographic, and the Bill and Melinda Gates Foundation.


Our Commitment to Equity and Inclusion

Bluecadet’s staff represents a wide pool of talent, views, backgrounds, and interests across our disciplines. We believe in Equity and Inclusion as a general principle and look for ways to actively amplify our team’s diverse perspectives in service of the stories and messages we are entrusted to tell.

Over the past six months, we have launched internal DEI programming with a dedicated consultant to inform our business and culture moving forward. For 2021, we plan to prioritize initiatives at all levels of our organization – reflecting on leadership actions and communication, training our managers on equity and inclusion best practices, and for the whole staff, implementing inclusive meeting structures and cross-group learning.

Machine Learning Engineering Intern: Environmental, Social, Governance (ESG) Investment Model Development

LOCATION: Remote and/or Tysons Corner, VA

POSITION HIGHLIGHTS:

Verstand AI (www.verstand.ai) is seeking interns with an interest in building custom data product and artificial intelligence solutions for clients in the financial services industry. Armed with knowledge of data science applications and machine learning algorithms, the machine learning intern will be instrumental in building high quality datasets to fine tuning models (building and retraining models) for maximizing performance. Along with the management of cloud environments,
Verstand interns will be responsible for ensuring data quality, scoring and evaluation of models, and continuous model operations. Additionally, support will be handed to Data Engineers to build ETL pipelines and BI Designers to design visualizations and dashboards. Knowledge of capital markets and trading strategies an advantage.

Most importantly, Verstand AI's interns will get an opportunity to work with cutting edge technologies and be part of data teams that help clients harness the power of artificial intelligence. Verstand’s interns will shape and build efficient and self-learning applications.

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • Work with product owners, data engineers, and BI designers to understand product requirements, data needs, and model design
  • Acquire data and build custom datasets using web-scraping or NLP tools
  • Perform data analysis on large structured or unstructured datasets, using machine learning to enrich data features and data quality
  • Design and build data extraction, transformation, and loading processes by writing custom data pipelines
  • Design, implement and support platforms that can provide ad-hoc access to large datasets and unstructured data
  • Perform model parameter and hyperparameter fine tuning to optimize model learn rates and maximize model performance
  • Participate in feature engineering planning sessions
  • Develop multiple model scoring and evaluation methodologies
  • Design visualizations and dashboards for reporting and rich storytelling

JOB REQUIREMENTS:

Minimum Experience, Skills and Education:

  • Knowledge of machine learning algorithms, their application for problem solving and MLOps
  • Strong Python, Java, R and SQL skills with understanding of software development
  • Deep knowledge of math, probability, and statistics
  • Experience with cloud platforms such as Amazon Web Services (AWS), Microsoft Azure, or Google Could Platform (GCP)
  • Working knowledge of Python Machine Learning libraries (SciKit Learn, TensorFlow, Pytorch, Keras)
  • Experience with base level data Python libraries (Pandas, NumPy, SciPy, Scapy, NLTK)
  • Working knowledge of scoring and evaluating machine learning models
  • Working knowledge of ETL pipelines and data ingestion methodology
  • Working knowledge of data visualization tools such as Power BI, Looker and Tableau
  • Effective written/spoken communication skills and strong problem-solving skills
  • Currently enrolled in Bachelor's degree from four-year College or university in Computer Science, Data Science or related field

Experience That Sets You Apart:

  • Experience with capital markets, time series analysis, trading strategies and algorithms
  • Experience and interest in ESG reporting, data points, and standards

Verstand AI is a fast-growing firm that believes in ongoing training and development for its staff. The firm's mission is to help both its commercial and public sector clients resolve data management challenges and move to delivering insight and benefits for stakeholders, customers and constituents.

Based out of Tysons Corner, VA, Verstand does business across the United States and is moving into Europe and Asia. If you're interested in working with us and have a desire to tackle challenging data problems, we welcome your interest and encourage you to apply.

position: Paid Intern to hire- Entry Level Sustainability Manager (Full-Time)
description:
Paid Intern to Entry Level Sustainability Manager (Full-time)

We only interview candidates that are local to the San Francisco Bay Area who can take the public transportation or drive to our location to work in Burlingame, California. This job requires physically working on site at our Burlingame location, Monday to Friday from 9:45 AM to 6:15 PM.

Please apply with a cover letter on why you think this job is a good fit for you. Applicants without a cover letter will not be considered.

This is a perfect job for someone who is passionate about the environment and is a recently graduated or someone who has less than 5 years of work experience with an undergraduate or graduate degree in environmental science related major. It is a perfect first job out of the college or the graduate program. You will learn a lot of real life skills while contributing to a more sustainable earth.

The job responsibilities include a lot of outreach, email and phone interactions with business customers in the San Francisco Bay Area, as well many face to face interactions with customers come to drop-off at our Eco Center.

You will get a chance to communicate with environmentally conscious customers who care about recycling electronics responsibility and value GreenCitizen’s service. With your passion for the environment, and training in your environmental science major, you are given tasks to educate the public about environmental practices in electronics recycling and all other sustainability subjects.

You will develop your communication and multi-tasking skills. You are constantly challenged to learn more about sustainability so you can contribute to meaningful discussions with our customers and motivate them to take action making everyday an Earth Day.

We are looking for a solid professional who is passionate about the environment, who is mature, a self-starter, a good learner, responsible, good attention to details, great computer skills, as well as communication and people skills. This professional needs to enjoy working with really good and competent staff and be able to multi-tasks and be well organized. You must be able safely lift 50 pounds.

After the initial 30 days paid internship temp position, if there is a good fit, the candidate will be converted to a full-time employee.

We have 8 paid holidays: New Year’s Day, President’s Day, Memorial Day, Independence Day, Labor Day, Thanksgiving Day, the day after Thanksgiving, and Christmas. We have 10 PTOs and 5 Sick Days. 50% Premium for employees for Kaiser and Delta Dental. 25% coverage for dependents.

The office is within walking distance to Millbrae BART/Caltrain Station

Why GreenCitizen?

GreenCitizen is an environmental conservation company that provides you with the information and services to help you live a sustainable life and make every day Earth Day.

GreenCitizen will help our customers do this in 7 ways such as follows:

1. Motivate you with inspiring environmental news around the world

2. Guide you on your green living journey with our actionable blog posts

3. Show you where to buy, reuse and recycle responsibly with our Green Directory

4. Recycle your electronics with our very own Earth-friendly recycling services

5. Recommend you eco-conscious products

6. Help you find careers in the environmental sector with our Green Jobs board

7. Contribute to the circular economy initiatives

What is our reputation?

Over 116 5 Stars Yelp

Over 66 4.8 Google Business

Over 81,000 99% positive on eBay

How many customers have we served and how much electronics have we diverted since 2005?

401,969 drop-off customers served

61,571 business pickup customers served

28,847,530 pounds of electronics recycled

267,451 units responsibly reused

What does our customer say about us?

I have completed two e-waste recycles with GreenCitizen now and I have nothing but praise for their whole operation. From the easy to use website with explanations of what can be recycled free of charge to the awesome rep who I have been emailing with to even great, friendly pickup staff.

Thor G. San Francisco, CA

These guys are great! They come to the building I work in a handful of times a year to collect eCycled items from all the tenants. I’ve also contacted them separately for an additional pick up with a quick and friendly response. Through the phone, email, and in person – everyone has been on point with the awesome services.

Ederlyn L.

Alameda, CA

Please send a cover letter and resume and must have direct supervisor references.

Hours and compensation:

40 hours a week; the shift is Monday through Friday. The compensation is dependent on qualification.

Location:

This job is based in Burlingame near the Millbrae BART and Caltrain stations. Free Shuttle stop is across the street from the BART/Caltrain stations.

How to Apply:

1) Email your resume along with a cover letter describing how you are passionate about the environment, and why you would be the best candidate for the job. Write in the subject line "Indeed: Intern-to-hire: Sustainability Account Manager, April 22, 2021"

2) Must have past direct supervisor or manager references and pass background and drug screening checks.

INTERNSHIP CONSIDERATIONS:
Intern will have senior standing in the area of study of Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Computer Networking/Administration, or a comparable area of study.

Intern must present a letter of recommendation from a professor in the area of study certifying that the student is prepared for an internship and will commit to the additional responsibilities placed on them by PAI.

Interns must be able to commit a minimum of 20 hours per week for on-site engagement with the Technology Services staff.

The intern must have completed the following course work prior to the start of the internship.

Computer Hardware

Operating Systems / Software

Networking Fundamentals (TCP/IP, Subnetting, Basic routing)

Systems Administration (Active Directory/LDAP, and Network Design/Management or equivalent course)

One secondary language course

RESRTICTIONS:
Internships will be limited to a one year term.

PAI reserves the right to terminate an internship at any point and for any reason.

Internships are tailored to the individual intern. Every intern will be given unique tasks and objectives based on their induvial artisanship, attention to detail, and diligence.

Interns will abide by PAI's Code of Conduct, Dress Code, and Employment Policies specified in PAI's Employee Handbook.

Interns will abide by PAI's Technology Services Areas of Responsibilities for Level One IT Technicians.

COMMITMENTS:
PAI commits a significant amount of resources in allowing interns to train within its environment. In return PAI expects each of its interns to respect the opportunity they are given. Each intern is expected to be on-site and engaged at least twenty (20) hours a week. They are to be involved in their work and engage in research for any project or task they have been given. They are also required to seek assistance from the IT infrastructure staff. Interns will be given tasks that will be outside their comfort areas and will require the expertise of the IT infrastructure staff. Interns must be committed to reaching out to anyone that can help them complete their assignments. Interns will be challenged and PAI expects them to be committed to meet the challenge.

WORKING CONDITIONS:
This work is performed in a call center / business office setting. The noise level is moderate. The working environment can be distracting due to noise.

EFFORT:
The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to see, hear, speak, and listen. The employee is frequently required to sit. The employee is occasionally required to stand; walk; use hands to finger, handle, or feel; reach with hands and arms and stoop or kneel. The employee may be required to lift and carry equipment not exceeding 50 lbs, which can be accommodated. Work can be stressful and requires a calm, patient demeanor.

Supervisory / Management Duties:
The employee is not responsible for supervising other positions.

Company Description

Join us and make YOUR mark on the World!

Are you interested in joining some of the brightest talent in the world to strengthen the United States’ security? Come join Lawrence Livermore National Laboratory (LLNL) where our employees apply their expertise to create solutions for BIG ideas that make our world a better place.

We are looking for individuals that demonstrate an understanding of working in partnership with team peers, who engage, advocate, and contribute to building an inclusive culture, and provide expertise to solve challenging problems.

Job Description

We have multiple openings for our Fall Undergraduate Internship Program taking place from October 1, 2021 to December, 2021. Our openings are for undergraduate level students who will be given the opportunity to engage in practical research to further their educational goals. The selected interns will provide technical and/or research support to projects in the areas of computational science, cyber defense, computer science, numerical methods, mathematics, or other related fields.

In this role you will:

  • Work with scientists, engineers, and technical staff members to provide technical and/or research support to projects in the areas of computational science, numerical methods, mathematics, or other related fields.
  • Under close supervision, will participate in research in assigned area.
  • Gather and analyze data and information in support of scientific research.
  • Participate in research planning and evaluation discussion.
  • Attend relevant on-site seminars (at least one per week).
  • Perform other duties as assigned.

Qualifications

  • Must be a continuing college or university student in good standing at an accredited institution pursuing an undergraduate degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Machine Learning, Computer Vision, or other related fields.
  • Ability to apply basic computational science and/or mathematical principles to solve technical problems.
  • Demonstrated effective communication skills.
  • Ability to present and communicate concepts and ideas.
  • Experience working with personal computers and familiarity with Word, Excel and PowerPoint.
  • Ability to work in a team environment.

Additional Information

Why Lawrence Livermore National Laboratory?

  • Included in 2020 Best Places to Work by Glassdoor!
  • Work for a premier innovative national Laboratory
  • Comprehensive Benefits Package
  • Flexible schedules (*depending on project needs)
  • Collaborative, creative, inclusive, and fun team environment

Learn more about our company, selection process, position types and security clearances by visiting our Career site.

Security Clearance

LLNL is a Department of Energy (DOE) and National Nuclear Security Administration (NNSA) Laboratory. Some positions will require a DOE L or Q clearance (please reference Security Clearance requirement above). If you are selected and a clearance is required, we will initiate a Federal background investigation to determine if you meet eligibility requirements for access to classified information or matter. In addition, all L or Q cleared employees are subject to random drug testing. An L or Q clearance requires U.S. citizenship. For additional information please see DOE Order 472.2.

Equal Employment Opportunity

LLNL is an affirmative action and equal opportunity employer that values and hires a diverse workforce. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, marital status, national origin, ancestry, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, protected veteran status, age, citizenship, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws.

If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation during the application or the recruiting process, please submit a request via our online form.

California Privacy Notice

The California Consumer Privacy Act (CCPA) grants privacy rights to all California residents. The law also entitles job applicants, employees, and non-employee workers to be notified of what personal information LLNL collects and for what purpose. The Employee Privacy Notice can be accessed here.

We are now looking for a Software Intern, IVA (Intelligent Video Analytics) to join our Metropolis team!

Intelligent machines powered by AI computers that can learn, reason and interact with people are no longer science fiction. Today, a self-driving car powered by AI can navigate through a country road at night and find its way. An AI-powered robot can learn motor skills through trial and error. This is truly an extraordinary time — the era of AI has begun.

What you’ll be doing:

  • Develop Deep Learning Neural Network Models for detecting and classifying pedestrians, cars and other objects/attributes in video

  • Utilize TensorFlow, PyTorch and other Deep Learning Frameworks to develop and test Computer Vision and Machine Learning algorithms

  • Implement the full video processing pipeline for real-time and embedded systems on NVIDIA GPU cards

What we need to see:

  • You are pursuing a Master's or Ph.D. degree in Electrical Engineering, Computer Science, or related field with an emphasis in Computer Vision

  • Experience processing video and image sequences, including image compression and file formats

  • Object detection in large data sets such as ImageNet

  • Deep understanding of the methods of Machine Learning and classifiers such as logistic regression, SVM, AdaBoost, and Decision Trees

  • Object tracking, window blanking, or video security applications

  • Strong programming skills including Python and C/C++

  • Experience in Machine Learning infrastructure development and optimization (framework, ML pipeline, deployment)
  • Experience in CUDA, OpenCL and GPU programming including compute kernel development and optimizations
  • Experience in Machine Learning acceleration through model compression, quantization and distillation.
  • Experience in high performance computing, high performance networking, distributed computing algorithms and systems

Inside this Business Group


Intel Architecture, Graphics, and Software (IAGS) brings Intel's technical strategy to life. We have embraced the new reality of competing at a product and solution level—not just a transistor one. We take pride in reshaping the status quo and thinking exponentially to achieve what's never been done before. We've also built a culture of continuous learning and persistent leadership that provides opportunities to practice until perfection and filter ambitious ideas into execution.


Posting Statement

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, religious creed, sex, national origin, ancestry, age, physical or mental disability, medical condition, genetic information, military and veteran status, marital status, pregnancy, gender, gender expression, gender identity, sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by local law, regulation, or ordinance.

Be autonomous

Our team members are self-directed and own their projects. We trust everyone to get their work done, no matter how they choose to get there.

Build awesome projects

You get to work with emerging technologies and learn best practices from the best in the industry.

Work with a top-notch team

Logicdrop is filled with smart, self-motivated, creative individuals that are continuously learning and building.

If this excites you, let's talk.


Are you looking to jump into a career in software development by working on meaningful, customer facing projects? At Logicdrop, we provide great work/life balance, realistic expectations, and a great culture.

We are thought leaders in the rapidly growing automated decisions, machine learning, and dynamic content space. Our platform helps companies disrupt their industries by utilizing our cutting edge technology to make better predictions, faster computations, and squeeze more value out of their data.

You will not be a number lost in the crowd. You will make a big difference by bringing our product to the next level with new technologies and features.

Requirements

  • Degree in software development or equivalent training, certification, or incredibly cool personal project
  • Passionate about development

Your typical work week will include:

  • Designing, implementing, and maintaining features in Logicdrop products
  • Meeting with project managers to discuss requirements
  • Developing in Java, Javascript, AngularJS, HTML
  • Working closely with QA to resolve issues

The quintessential candidate must possess:

  • Recently completed or in the process of obtaining a computer science related diploma
  • Development experience in at least two of the following: HTML5, JavaScript, CSS3, Java, C# or Python
  • Familiarity with browser testing and debugging
  • Basic understanding of Internet architectures, including web, application, and database components
  • Strong attention to detail
  • Ability to work in a fast-paced environment
  • Fundamental verbal and written communication skills
  • Eager to learn and participate in development discussions

To apply for this job, please send an email to jobs@logicdrop.com and include the desired position, your resume, and a short introduction about yourself.

Programmer Intern

Job Title


Programmer Intern


Alternate Job Title(s)


Software Developer Intern, Application Developer Intern


Department


Information Technology, Programming Services


Status


Non-Exempt (Hourly)


Direct Report


App Dev Team Lead


About our Development Team

Do you love technology? We sure do! With over 4,000 employees and rapid growth in our future, there is no shortage of development challenges and opportunities in our company. You will be a part of a broad and varied IT ecosystem that is rapidly maturing. We work with a strong group that truly cares about proper development methods, continuous education, and personal growth and learning. While our goal is to find and retain exceptional talent for our full-time positions, our programming interns have also gone on to work in development positions at Apple, Microsoft, Boeing, Lockheed Martin, Northrop Grumman, and GE Financial.

Required Skills

  • Beginner to intermediate software development skills
  • Interest in software development beyond classroom assignments
  • Ability to work remotely
  • Ability to conduct independent research with technical staff and subject matter experts
  • Ability to communicate complex information easily
  • Ability to voice concerns and advise on possible solutions

Required Education

  • Currently pursuing a degree in Computer Science

Job Tasks

  • Collaboratively develop solutions during pair programming
  • Solve intermediate to complex problems with minimal guidance by conducting independent research
  • Interpret business requirements into technical and/or functional documentation and solutions
  • Design, build, enhance, debug, maintain existing and create new .NET applications using C#, F#, and SQL Server, as well as web applications using React and TypeScript
  • Maintain and debug legacy applications that are built on .NET and SQL Server

Schedule

We are flexible with school and project schedules, however, potential candidates should be committed to working a minimum of 30 hours per two-week pay period, Monday - Friday, between the hours of 8 A.M. and 8 P.M. We are looking for someone who would like a long-term internship, possibly 18 - 36 months. Apply online at https://acadian.candidatecare.jobs/ then click on Acadian Ambulance, Current Openings, Corporate / Administrative & Support.

EOE/AA

This position is located in Lafayette, LA. Remote work is not available.

The Information Security Intern is a member of the Sage Intacct Operations team and provides Information Security support to the Sr. Director, Information Security and other appropriate security and cross functional team members. This position provides an excellent opportunity to gain or enhance your Information Security experience and contribute to the organization in a meaningful manner as it relates to Information Security compliance and risk management.

Responsibilities:

  • Request, collect, track, organize and when necessary, present security compliance related information from various departments, external vendors and partners
  • Participate in periodic information systems and compliance audits, risk / vulnerability assessments and penetration testing.
  • Assist with SSAE 18 (SOC 1), SOC 2, PCI and other third-party compliance efforts as necessary
  • Assist or drive special projects as assigned

Requirements:

  • Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Information Security or other relevant STEM fields
  • Must have experience with MS Office products with a strong working knowledge of Excel Pivot Tables and Charts.
  • Experience in performing infrastructure and application Vulnerability Testing/Assessments a plus
  • Ability to multitask, prioritize, coordinate, work well under pressure and meet deadlines
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills, interpersonal and collaborative skills
  • Previous or current experience related to Information Security concepts a plus
  • Experience or relevant coursework in statistical analysis
  • Must be a critical thinker with strong problem-solving skills and a "can do” attitude
  • Must be able to and willing to work independently with minimal amount of supervision

Company Overview

At Veo, we're bringing the next generation of mobility sharing to cities and universities globally through our dockless e-vehicle system. We also offer fat-tire bikes, cargo bikes and ADA-compliant bikes – making us the only shared mobility provider with this breadth of options. We design and engineer our own vehicles, hardware and software systems to provide a greener, healthier mode of transportation to make the communities we serve more sustainable and livable. Our mission is to offer the best combination of multi-modal sharing technology and seamless customer service, so users can unlock joy in their day. We are looking for exceptionally talented individuals who are ready to take on exciting challenges and their own solutions. We are headquartered in Chicago, IL, but we are hiring across the U.S. Join us!

Job Summary

Do you want to apply AI to a real product? Do you want to practice your skill sets in a production application to customers around the nation? Are you willing to build a bridge between software and hardware and apply cutting-edge techniques to serve the users? Are you excited about solving some of the most challenging problems in transportation and urban planning? If so, you might be Veo’s Computer Vision engineer Intern!

  • This role can be done as a co-op or internship. Hiring will be done a rolling basis.

Responsibilities

  • Research and develop prototype using deep learning algorithms with a special focus on the perception modules and object detection
  • Optimize our current models
  • Help engineering team integrate it into the production application
  • Troubleshoot and debug model

Qualifications and Skills

  • MS or Ph.D degree in Computer Science or equivalent
  • Solid understanding of Deep Learning, Mathematics and Statistics
  • Experienced in Tensorflow or equivalent
  • Logical thinker and effective communicator with a clean and efficient coding style
  • Passionate about making the world a better place to live and ride
  • Published papers are a strong bonus

Benefits and Perks

  • Competitive compensation
  • Opportunity to work in a fast-paced, hyper-growth technology company
  • Veo credits
  • A commitment to professional development and mentorship

position: Recycling Innovation Engineering Intern Fall Co-Op Software Projects
description:
Summary

Posted: Jun 17, 2021
Role Number:200206188
Are you a problem solver and self-starter? Do you thrive in a startup-like environment and seek to be a part of something bigger? Are you passionate about recycling and working towards a closed loop supply chain? As an Engineering Intern on Apple's Recycling Innovation team, you will be a part of solving the difficult challenges on the path to a closed loop supply chain. We celebrate diversity and the innovation that it spurs in everything we do, from amazing technology to industry-leading environmental efforts. Join Apple, and help us leave the world better than we found it.Apple is committed to being 100 percent carbon neutral for its supply chain and products by 2030. The Recycling Innovation team supports this effort by developing industry-leading technology to recover and reuse more materials from end-of-use devices. Apple’s publicly announced projects, Daisy and Dave, are keystone projects to Apple’s closed loop supply chain goal and are a result of this program. If you’re interested in being a part of a team that’s constantly learning and problem-solving, we’d love to talk with you.
Key Qualifications
  • Must be a self starter and independent worker with innovation, integrity and attention to details
  • Able to handle ambiguity and make decisions with uncertain or limited data
  • Able to communicate and build relationships effectively in a worldwide environment
  • Excellent communication skills, with the ability to distill complex ideas into concise business-focused messages
  • Ability to present findings with confidence, backed up by data, research, and prototyping results
  • Insatiable curiosity with a proven ability to propose creative solutions to difficult problems
  • Proven ability to transform ideas into reality
  • Demonstrated interest in data science
  • Ability to start in September, 2021 for a four to six month co-op
Description
The candidate will join the Recycling Innovation team, responsible for R&D, design, testing and qualifying of new recycling technologies to further Apple’s closed-loop goals, with a focus on data science and machine learning. The candidate will work closely with the Apple engineering team to research and develop new recycling technologies, assess their feasibility and utility through experimentation, and present a recommendation for how to push the technology towards deployment. The candidate will be expected to:Assume the responsibilities of the Directly Responsible Individual (DRI) for assigned projectsDevelop a project plan to work diligently towards finding the best solution for complex recycling challengesCombine industry research, consultation with internal specialists, and hands-on experimentation to inform selected solutionsDesign and build prototypes to explore feasibility of proposed solutions and inform the design of scalable systemsExplore text and image datasets to identify patternsRecommend best path forward to move from lab-scale prototype to scalable and deployable processGenerate required documentation to capture final solution details and transfer knowledge to deployment partners
Education & Experience
Undergraduate or graduate student working towards a technical degree which includes studies of machine learning, computer vision, statistics, operations research, robotics, or closely related fields with demonstrated experience working on projects which involve these skills.
Additional Requirements

    Strong, demonstrated interest in data science and solid, proven grasp of data analysis

    Familiarity with Python, Java, C++, Swift, or similar programming language

    Knowledge of MS Excel and Excel VBA.

    Comfort with large-scale databases and distributed computing with a working knowledge of SQL is a plus

    Practical experience and theoretical understanding of computer vision methods (e.g., local feature matching) or deep learning models (e.g., CNN) is a plus

Overview:

Work closely with the Noke team to develop the front end, backend or mobile application.

Responsibilities:

  • Build high-quality, robust features for Nokē products.
